Policy: Official Letter No.01-12/24-231 of 1999 the State Committee for Environmental Protection regarding delegation of plenary powers in the sphere of environmental protection.

Policy: Decree No. 895 of 1999 on land use and building.
Policy_Content: This Decree, in implementation of the Act on land use and building, provides for land use planning and assessment and monitoring of impact on the environment of planned activities. Article 1 lists environmental features that must be taken into account in regional land use planning. The Ministry of the Environment shall organize the monitoring of the state and development of land use and the built environment, and the maintenance of the necessary database. Preparation of national land-use objectives shall be organized so as to allow for public debate and interaction. Article 33 and following concern in particular foreshore areas. Article 99 concerns Cross-border environmental impact.

Policy: Act No. 132 of 1999 on land use and building.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Act is to ensure that the use of land and water areas and building activities on them create preconditions for a favourable living environment and promote ecologically, economically, socially and culturally sustainable development. The Act also aims to ensure that everyone has the right to participate in the preparation process, and that planning is high quality and interactive, that expertise is comprehensive and that there is open provision of information on matters being processed. Objectives in land use planning are set out in section 5. Agreements made by a local authority regarding planning and the implementation of plans shall not override the objectives and content requirements of planning laid down in this Act Section 22 concerns national land use objectives, whereas section 24 concerns regional planning. Section 72 and following contain special provisions concerning shore areas. Section 92 and following provide for expropriation of land for public purposes. Several provisions of the Act concern conservation of water resources, water supply and drainage.

Policy: Law No. 2376 on the socio-economic and cultural development of high mountainous regions.
Policy_Content: This Law aims to preserve original landscapes and ecosystems, ensure the rational use of natural resources and implement policies on the sustainable social-economic and cultural development of high mountainous regions in the following sectors: (a) agricultural production, primarily field cropping, cattle husbandry, vegetable-growing, fruit-growing, apiculture, fish-breeding, hunting and forestry, as well as other types of traditional local farming; (b) industrial production, primarily exploitation of local natural resources in compliance with the sustainable development principles provided by the Charter of the Alps Convention, processing industry, household trade, renewable energy and construction of small-capacity hydropower stations; and (c) tourism, health resorts and recreational businesses. To promote the socio-economic and cultural development of high mountainous regions, the Georgian government shall design a state program of soft loan investment strategies, the parameters of which shall be determined annually in the state budget. This program will promote: (a) development of tourism, health resorts and recreation business; (b) protection, restoration and involvement in tourism of historical-architectural and natural monuments; (c) revival and further development of business and social-cultural traditions and creation of the relevant research centres; and (d) development of the categories of protected territories in high mountainous regions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Agricultural development,Mountain area,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Renewable energy,Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Tourism

Policy: Regional Law No. 44-ZS “On state support of subsistence farmers producing agricultural commodities”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes terms and conditions for granting state support to subsistence farmers producing agricultural commodities. Subsistence farming shall be intended as a form of non-entrepreneurial activity with a scope of producing and processing of agricultural commodities. Subsistence farming shall be regulated by contracts concluded with agricultural organizations of various forms. State support to subsistence farmers shall be granted in the following forms: (a) leasing and crediting; (b) allotment of pastures and  hayfields; (c) supply of animal feed; (d) organization of agricultural cooperatives; and (e) guarantee of stable sale of agricultural commodities.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Forestry) (Scotland) Regulations 1999 (S.S.I. No. 43 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations implement, for Scotland, changes made to Council Directive 85/337/EC, implemented by the 1998 Regulations, made by Council Directive 97/11/EC. They also implement the extension of both Directives to the Contracting Parties of the European Economic Area (EEA) under Article 74 and Annex XX paragraph I.1 of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, as given effect by Decision No.20/1999 of the EEA Joint Committee adopted on 26th February 1999. As in the 1998 Regulations, there is a prohibition on carrying out any work or operations in relation to a project which is a "relevant project" unless consent has been obtained from the Forestry Commissioners or, on appeal, the Scottish Ministers. A further new provision gives the Forestry Commissioners power, in accordance with Directive 85/337/EC, as amended, to exempt particular projects from the application of the Regulations (reg. 4). "Relevant project" is defined in regulation 3 as one of four types of project relating to forestry which does not constitute development regulated by the legislation on town and country planning but which is likely to have substantial effects on the environment. In a new provision, a project which covers an area falling below certain thresholds specified in Schedule 2 to the Regulations is to be treated as not likely to have substantial effects on the environment. However, the Commissioners or the Scottish Ministers have power to treat such a project as a relevant project requiring consent where, in their opinion, exceptional circumstances make it likely that the project will have substantial effects on the environment. A person who proposes to carry out a project may apply to the Commissioners for an opinion as to whether the project is a relevant project. An opinion or direction that the project is not a relevant project will lapse if the project is not completed within five years (regs. 5 to 8). Applications to the Commissioners for consent for a relevant project must be accompanied by an environmental statement which must contain the information required by Schedule 1 to the Regulations. Where it appears that the project may be likely to have significant effects on the environment in another State of the European Economic Area, provision is made for the authorities of that State to be consulted before a decision is made. In making their decision, the Commissioners are required to have regard to the environmental statement and the direct and indirect effects on environmental factors specified in Schedule 4. The Commissioners are given powers to serve enforcement notices where relevant projects are carried out without consent or in breach of conditions. The person served with such a notice may appeal to the Scottish Ministers. Penalties are specified for breach of an enforcement notice.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: These Regulations come into force on 6 September, 1999.

Policy: Mining and Quarrying Safety and Health Act 1999.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the operation of mines, other than coal mines. It aims at protecting the safety and health of persons at mines and persons who may be affected by operations and at requiring that the risk of injury and illness to any person resulting from operations is at an acceptable level. It consists of 20 Parts divided into 279 sections. Part 3 sets safety and health obligations and Part 4 contains provisions about the operation of mines. Part 9 is dedicated to inspectors and their powers and Part 11 deals with accidents and incidents. Part 14 concerns legal proceeding and Part 15 offences under the Act.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: Ss 1–2 of this Act enter into force on 2 September 1999; pt 1 div 4, pts 6, 12 and sch 2 on 29 October 1999 (1999 SL No. 244). Remaining provisions on 16 March 2001.

Policy: Order No.34 of 1999 of the State Committee on Land Policy regarding validation of the Agreement on interaction between the State Committee on Land Policy and Federal Geodetic and Cartographic Service.
Policy_Content: The President of the State Committee on Land Policy orders to all structural divisions of the Committee, State Committees on Land Resources and Land Survey of the subjects of the Russian Federation, subordinated enterprises, organizations and institutions to adopt the aforesaid Agreement (attached to the present document) for guidance in carrying out geodetic and cartographic activity in the process of carrying out land survey and keeping state land cadastre. Heads of State Committees on Land resources and Land Survey of the subjects of the Russian Federation must: 1). Organize registration and calculation of geodetic and cartographic work in the process of execution on the subordinated territories and by 1 March annually submit to the Land monitoring Division information on the accomplished work; 2). To provide for annual handing-in to the territorial inspections of the State Geodetic Survey information on the planned and accomplished geodetic and cartographic work. The aforesaid Agreement determines the modalities and contents of interaction between the State Committee on Land Policy and Federal Geodetic and Cartographic Service in the following directions: 1). coordination of geodetic and cartographic work; 2). elaboration and carrying out arrangements aimed at carrying out concerted technical policy in the field of geodetic and cartographic activity; 3). coordination and unification of technical requirements to the final outcome of geodetic and cartographic work and its certification; 4). setting up and keeping geodetic and cartographic funds; 5). licensing of geodetic and cartographic activity.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Implementation Measures of Gansu Province on the Land Administration Law of the People's Republic of China.
Policy_Content: The Measures are formulated according to the Land Administration Law and its implementing regulations. The Land Administration Law shall regulate the right of use the state owned land or the collective land. The right of uses the forestry or grassland should be regulated according to the Forestry Law or the Grassland Law. The province shall implement a registration system in accordance with the Law, the use of state owned land must apply for the certificate of state owned land use. The local government shall compile the comprehensive land use plans. Conversion of land from agriculture use to construction use is strictly controlled, the basic farmland shall occupy 80 percent of the total cultivated land. The local government shall carry out inspections and reclaim land for agricultural purpose. The legal responsibilities are provided in chapter five.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Act No. 29 laying down provisions for the protection, the development and the improvement of mountain territories.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act, which is divided into three Titles, aims at supporting the socio-economic development of mountain areas falling within the Molise Region, giving particular regard to environmental protection. The Molise Region, therefore, defines criteria and initiatives intended to, inter alia, guarantee the proper and rational use of mountain resources. The provisions hereby established shall apply to territories belonging to Mountain Communities as rearranged by article 28 of Act No. 142 of 1990 and falling within the less favoured areas delineated by Title IX of Regulation 950/1997/EC. Administrative tasks are entrusted to Mountain Communities in matter of hydrogeological and forestry restoration, reforestation, pasture rearrangement, restriction of the use of fertilizers and phytopharmaceutical substances, promotion of organic forms of production, management of sylvo-pastoral resources. Article 3 establishes the Regional Fund for Mountain, whose beneficiaries are specified by article 5. Title III concerns special initiatives to be undertaken to promote mountain agriculture, taking into particular account mountain zootechnics, production of milk and dairy products, use of cultural techniques compatible with the environment, fodder culture and cereal production. For this purpose, subsidies shall be granted by the Region. Article 29 sets up the Permanent Conference for Mountain under the Regional Council Chairmanship. The Conference shall exercise advisory functions relative to, among others, mountain policies and allocation of financial resources to Mountain Communities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Keyword: Agricultural development,Less favoured areas,Mountain area,Special fund,Institution,Subsidy/incentive

Policy: Mines and Minerals Act, 1999 (Chapter 66:01).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the granting of various rights relative to prospecting and mining of minerals, for environmental obligations related to mining operations and other duties of persons carrying out mining operations, and control of mining operations. “Minerals” is defined so as to exclude petroleum ,as defined in section 2 of the Petroleum (Exploration and Production) Act, and public and private water when used for a primary, secondary or tertiary use, as defined in the Water Act. Rights that may be granted are called "mineral concession" and include a prospecting licence (Part IV), a retention licence (Part V), a mining licence (Part VI), or a minerals permit (Part VII). The Minister may exercise any of his or her functions through the Permanent Secretary, the Director of Mines or the Director of Geological Survey. No holder of a mineral concession shall exercise any right thereunder without the written consent of the President or the owner or lawful occupant upon lands specified in section 60. The owner or lawful occupier of any land within the area of a mineral concession shall retain the right to graze stock upon or to cultivate the surface of such land insofar as such grazing or cultivation does not interfere with the proper use of such area for prospecting, retention or mining purposes. The holder of a mining concession shall carry out mining operations having regard to laws, good mining practice and the environment and shall, in accordance with international mining industry standards, submit an environment impact assessment as part Project Feasibility Study Report (sect. 65). The same section also provides for rehabilitation of the soil.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Southern Africa

Policy: Ordonnance nº 99/001 complétant certaines dispositions de la loi  n° 94/01 du 20 janvier 1994 portant régime des forêts, de la faune et de la pêche.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions de l'article 71(1) de la loi n° 94/01 du 20 janvier 1994 portant régime des forêts, de la faune et de la pêche sont complétées ainsi qu'il suit: "les grumes sont transformées à hauteur de 70 % de leur production par l'industrie locale pendant une période transitoire de cinq (5) ans à compter de la date de promulgation de la présente loi. Passé ce délai, l'exportation des grumes est interdite et la totalité de la production nationale est transformée par les industries locales. Toutefois, sous réserve du paiement d'une surtaxe, l'exportation des grumes pourra se poursuivre dans le cadre de la promotion de certaines essences. Policy: Forestry Commission Act, 1999 (Act No. 571 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The Forestry Commission is established under section 1 as a body corporate. The Minister responsible for forestry shall have ministerial responsibility for the Commission. Objects and functions of the Commission are outlined in section 2. They include regulation of the utilization of forest and timber resources of Ghana, management of the nation’s forest reserves and protected areas, assistance to the private sector and other bodies in relation with implementation of forest and wildlife policies, the development of forest plantations, restoration of degraded forests, and afforestation for industrial purposes. The Commission shall be divided into four Divisions: Forest Services Division; Forest Products Division; Timber Export Development Division; Wildlife Division. The Commission shall be at liberty to re-organise the Divisions established by this Act. (32 sections)

Policy: Decree-Law No. 54/99 establishing the basic law for the Electricity System of Cape Verde.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 114 articles divided in 22 Chapters, establishes the foundations of the Electric System and has as fundamental objectives the promotion of national socio-economic development and the preservation of the environment, in strict observance of the following principles: a) ensuring a safe and reliable supply of electricity, as well as an increasing the coverage of service to all consumers, at a reasonable, fair and non-discriminatory price in use; b) increasing the use of renewable energy sources and cogeneration for electricity production; c) promoting efficiency in the production, transport, distribution and use of electricity in the country; d) attracting national and foreign private investments into the Electric System, including self- and independent producers, through the definition of stable, equitable, favorable and transparent conditions for investment; e) encouraging healthy competition and competition in the Electric System. In addition, it structures the national electricity system regulating electricity production, transport, distribution, concessions, licences, sale, tariffs and service quality aspects.

Policy: Conservation Areas Act 1999 (Cap. 30.15).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the institution of “Conservation Areas”, i.e. areas declared to be such under section 3. Conservation Areas may include marine areas within the territorial sea, any terrestrial area including swamps, islets, reef flats, channels, sand banks and coral reef" in the territory of Tuvalu. The purposes of a Conservation area may be one or more of the following: (a) environment protection, including coastal, marine and terrestrial areas; (b) conservation and protection of biosphere reserves and habitats; (c) biological diversity preservation; (d) promotion of scientific studies and research on conservation areas. No person shall hunt, kill or capture any turtle, bird or fish in conservation areas designated under this Act.

Policy: Prevention of Pollution of the Sea (Garbage) Regulations (No. S 363 of 1999).
Policy_Content: These Regulations govern disposal of garbage in order to prevent marine pollution. The provisions shall apply to Singapore ships and to other ships while they are in Singapore waters. The disposal of all plastics from a ship outside any Special Area is prohibited (reg. 4). Regulation 5 concerns the disposal of garbage within special areas. Regulation 6 concerns the disposal of garbage into the sea within five hundred metres of fixed or floating installations. Restrictions on Singapore ships entering the Antarctic area are provided for in regulation 7. All ships shall carry a garbage management plan and a garbage record book as provided for in regulations 9 and 10.

Policy: Order No. 232 of the Ministry of Natural resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the method of calculation of emission of carbon dioxide to the atmosphere from thermal power plants and boiler plants.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the method of calculation of emission of carbon dioxide to the atmosphere from thermal power plants and boiler plants. It shall be compulsory for all legal and natural persons operating on the national territory. Average emission data submitted by enterprises for reporting period (quarter, half year, nine months, year) shall be taken into consideration for the calculation of gross emissions for reporting period. Amount of emissions of carbon dioxide shall depend upon the type and the composition of fuel, burning mode and efficiency of furnace equipment.

Policy: Ordonnance sur l'utilisation des organismes en milieu confiné (Ordonnance sur l'utilisation confinées, OUC).
Policy_Content: L'article 1er établit que la présente ordonnance a pour but de protéger l'homme et l'environnement, en particulier les animaux et les plantes, ainsi que leurs biocénoses et leurs biotopes, des atteintes nuisibles ou incommodantes résultant de l'utilisation d'organismes en milieu confiné. En outre, elle vise à contribuer à la conservation de la diversité biologique et de la fertilité du sol. L'ordonnance est formée par 31 articles divisés en 4 chapitres dont les plus importants sont: Exigence relative à l'utilisation d'organismes en milieu confiné (2). Taches des autorités (3). Ce chapitre contient 6 sections: Vérification des notifications et des demandes d'autorisation (1); Surveillance dans les entreprises (2); Surveillance des transports (3); Collecte, traitement et confidentialité des données (4); Emoluments (5); Directives, formation et perfectionnement (6). Cinq annexes sont jointes: Définition des techniques de modification génétique (1); Evaluation du risque (2); Informations requises pour l'enregistrement, la notification et l'autorisation d'activités (3); Mesures de sécurités (4); Modification du droit en vigueur (5).

Policy: Ordonnance sur l'utilisation d'organismes dans l'environnement (Ordonnance sur la dissémination dans l'environnement, ODE).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance a pour but de protéger l'homme et l'environnement, en particulier les animaux et les plantes, ainsi que leurs biocénoses et leurs biotopes, des atteintes nuisibles ou incommodantes résultant de l'utilisation d'organismes dans l'environnement. Elle vise aussi à conserver la diversité biologique ainsi que la fertilité du sol. En outre elle règle l'utilisation d'organismes, en particulier l'utilisation d'organismes génétiquement modifiés ou pathogènes, dans l'environnement. L'article 3 définit certains termes comme, par exemple, "organismes", "microorganismes", "organismes génétiquement modifiés", "mise dans le commerce", etc. L'ordonnance comprend 42 articles divisés en 4 chapitres dont les plus importants sont: Exigences relatives à l'utilisation d'organismes dans l'environnement (2). Ce chapitre est divisé en 4 sections: Exigences générales (1); Dissémination expérimentale d'organismes génétiquement modifiés ou pathogènes (2); Mise dans le commerce d'organismes génétiquement modifiés ou pathogènes (3); Exportation d'organismes génétiquement modifiés (4). Le chapitre 3 "Taches des autorités" comprend 7 sections: Autorisation des disséminations expérimentales (1); Autorisation de mise dans le commerce (2); Surveillance de l'utilisation d'organismes dans l'environnement (3); Lutte contre les organismes (4); Collecte, traitement et publication de données (5); Emoluments (6); Directives, formation et perfectionnement (7). Cinq annexes sont jointes: Définition des techniques de modification génétique (1); Critères (2); Informations requises pour les demandes d'autorisation concernant des organismes pathogènes, mais non génétiquement modifiés (3); Evaluation du risque (4); Modification du droit en vigueur (5).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er novembre 1999.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 91/99 establishing the Statute of the Provincial Supervision for the management of environmental action.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision establishes the Statute of the Provincial Supervision for the management of environmental action, the aims of which are the planning and management of the areas defined in Presidential Decree No. 6/95 of 29 November. It consists of 3 chapters defining composition, competencies and structure for the involved sectors of this environmental institution.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 946 of 1999 regarding validation of the Regulation on State Inspection over carrying out activity in the field of active impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes on the national territory.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. Active impact is an impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes exerted for the purpose of their regulation and reduction of potential damage to the population originating from such processes (protection of agricultural crops from damage done by hail, regulation of precipitation, fog dispersion and hauling down of avalanches). The document consists of III Chapters. Chapter I lays down the general provisions. Chapter II regards the modalities of carrying out state inspection over activity in the field of active impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes. Chapter III establishes the rights and the duties of state inspectors.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 945 of 1999 on state cadastre valuation of land.
Policy_Content: The Government, for the purpose of introduction of economic methods of the management of land resources and the improvement of state management of land, entitles the State Committee on Land Policy to carry out in the period of 1999-2001 state cadastre valuation of all categories of land for the purpose of taxation and other purposes established by law. Regional executive bodies are recommended on presentation of the territorial branches of the State Committee on Land Policy to adopt legislative acts necessary for the realization of state cadastre valuation of land and to validate its results. The Government decrees to establish that financing of state cadastre valuation of land is carried out at the expense of land charges and rent that must be refunded to Federal and Regional budgets.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 134 on registration of and control over radiation dose limits for individuals.
Policy_Content: Control over radiation dose limits for individuals includes (i) external beta rays, neutron, X-ray, gamma-radiation by using dosimeter, (ii) airborne radioactivity and excrements by sampling and radioactive substances in the body by using spectrometer, and (iii) fissile material capable of sustaining chain division by using dosimeter. The Directorates and local sanitary-epidemiological services carry out radiation control and quality control, as well as regularly monitor the registered documents on radiation. Radiation dose control shall be carried out monthly and quarterly. The results shall be registered and kept for 50 years.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Data collection/reporting,Hazardous substances,Institution,Monitoring,Pollution control,Public health,Radiation,Registration,Inspection

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 134 on radiological-hygienic passport.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets forth provisions on issuance of radiation-hygienic passport to landowners, enterprises and organizations using ionizing radiation sources. This Decree aims at ensuring radiation safety for the living conditions of the population. The passport shall be issued by the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the hygienic-epidemiological control service of the Ministry of Health. The passport includes (i) radiation safety assessment, (ii) information on risk groups in the area affected by high levels of ionizing radiation, (iii) estimation of radiation level in lands and enterprises and organizations using ionizing radiation sources, (iv) requirements on radiation safety planning, and (v) evaluation of the effectiveness of measures implemented to ensure radiation safety. In addition, other information shall be registered to evaluate radiation safety standards, analyse radiation doses exposed the population and level of radiation contamination. Passport templates are attached to this Decree in the annexes.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Nº 194 - Adopta la Carta Orgánica Administrativa de la Comarca Ngäbe-Buglé.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto adopta la Carta Orgánica Administrativa de la Comarca Ngäbe-Buglé. Para la función administrativa, la superficie de la Comarca se divide en tres grandes regiones, denominadas Ño Kribo, Nidrini y Kadriri, éstas en distritos, corregimientos y regimientos, con cabecera en Buabti, en la región Kadriri. El territorio de la Comarca, áreas anexas e islas se organizan en tantos distritos, corregimientos y regimientos como sea necesarios, para garantizar una apropiada y eficaz administración para el desarrollo y progreso de dicho territorio y sus habitantes.

Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Cantonal Forestry Law of 1 February 1999. Article 1 establishes that the Construction, Environment and Economic Office is the competent authority in the Canton. Policy: Resolution No. 10 of 1999 on environmental standards (air and water).
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is the protection of environment. The present Resolution is composed of 7 Chapters, 2 Annexes and 5 Tables. Chapter 1 deals with terms and definitions. Chapter 2 specifies the objectives and scope of environmental standards. Chapter 3 defines requirements and conditions for air and water standards. Chapter 4 deals with air quality standards. Chapters 5 and 6 lay down standards for air and water pollution sources. Chapter 7 contains general provisions. Annex I contains air quality indicators. Annex II contains indicators for industrial sewage water quality. Table I contains air quality standards. Table II contains methods for measuring concentrations of air quality. Table III contains the maximum limits of gas and vapours that may be emitted by coal burning. Table IV contains standards of substances emitted in the air by industries. Table 5 contains industrial sewage water standards.

Policy: Regulation No. 221-P of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection on the system of environmental monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Regulation shall be applicable to programmes, projects and arrangements elaborated and implemented by the ministries, institutions, local self-government, organizations and enterprises irrespectively of the form of property that may cause negative environmental impact. The purpose of the monitoring shall be: (a) control over the elaboration and application of programmes, projects and arrangements; (b) analysis and Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA); (c) formation of environmental monitoring database. The authorized state institution entitled to carry out monitoring shall be the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation No. 82 of the Minister of Environment validating the Requirements for Rooms and Facilities Accommodating Radiation Sources, for the Construction Elements thereof, and for Safe Use of Radiation Sources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes general requirements for rooms and facilities accommodating radiation sources, for the construction elements thereof, and for use of radiation sources. In rooms and facilities accommodating radiation sources, licensees for activities involving radiation shall apply safety measures according to the magnitude of external or internal radiation doses caused by radiation

Policy_Content: This decree specifies anew all information to be supplied when making an application for the discharge of polluting substances in surface waters. Policy: Regulations of Shenzhen Special Economic Zone on Fire Prevention and Control(2009).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are enacted in accordance with the Law of the People’s Republic of China on Fire Prevention and Control, aiming to prevent fire disaster and decrease fire detriment, and protect the safety of citizen’s person and property as well as public property. Policy: Regulation No 16 of 1999 on the limitation of emissions of volatile organic compounds when transport and storing, loading or unloading of petrol.
Policy_Content: This Regulation here determines the emission limit values for volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emitted into the ambient air by installations and facilities for the storage and loading or unloading of petrol, including technological operations related to the loading or unloading of mobile gas tanks for the transport of gasoline between terminals or between terminals and service stations, including the direct measures aimed at reducing the effective volume of petrol vapor emitted into the ambient air; and further sets various verification and monitoring issues.

Policy: Regional Development Plan Law
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Federal Land Use Planning Act (BGBl. I p. 2081, p. 2102) and the Land Use Planning Law of 28 April 1998 of Sachsen-Anhalt. The Law lays down provisions relating to the regional development plan of Sachsen-Anhalt. In particular, the purpose of the Law is to maintain the perfect functioning of the ecosystem in the populated and unpopulated area of the Land. In all parts of Sachsen-Anhalt balanced economic, infrastructural, social, environmental and cultural conditions shall be ensured. The text consists of 7 Parts.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water

Policy: Décret nº 99-1819 portant approbation des statuts-type des groupements de développement dans le secteur de l'agriculture et de la pêche.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte statuts-type des groupements de développement dans le secteur de l'agriculture et de la pêche. Il s'agit de personnes morales, dotées de la personnalité civile et de l'autonomie financière, auxquelles adhèrent les propriétaires, les exploitants agricoles et les pêcheurs. Leurs missions, outre aux missions spécifiques fixées par leurs statuts, sont notamment: la protection des ressources naturelles et la rationalisation de leur utilisation; l'exécution des travaux agricoles et des services de pêche; l'équipement de leurs périmètres d'intervention en équipement ruraux nécessaires; la sauvegarde, le traitement et la garde des plantations et des cultures; l'aide des organismes concernés à l'apurement des situations agraires, l'augmentation de la productivité des exploitations agricoles; le développement des systèmes de parcours et des techniques d'élevage; l'encadrement de leurs adhérents en les orientant vers les meilleures techniques agricoles et de pêche et l'appui pour les aider à valoriser leurs produits dans les marchés locaux et étrangers; l'établissement de relations de coopération et d'échange des expériences dans le domaine de l'agriculture et de la pêche avec les autres organismes agricoles locaux et étrangers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Joint Circular No. 102/1999/TTLT/BTC-BNNPTNN providing guidance on establishment, management and use of the Fund for combating illegal deforesttation and production and transportation of and trade in forest products.
Policy_Content: This joint Circular of the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural development concerns the establishment of a fund for forest protection measures. The fund may be established by Ranger Sub-departments as well as Forest re-checking Stations that are competent to impose administrative sanctions in accordance with Decree No. 77 of 1996 on sanctions on violations in the field of forest management and protection and forest production management. The Fund shall be established only at provincial level and be controlled by state financial agencies and the State Treasury.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Special fund,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures

Policy: Ley Nº 297 – Para establecer el “Laboratorio de Investigaciones Ambientales de Puerto Rico” mediante la transferencia del Laboratorio Ambiental del Departamento de Recursos Naturales y Ambientales con el de la Junta de Calidad Ambiental, disponer sobre su organización y funcionamiento, establecer sus deberes y facultades; y para transferirle funciones.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se definen las funciones y los objetivos del Laboratorio de Investigaciones Ambientales de Puerto Rico, que contemplan: (a) ofrecer apoyo científico y de laboratorio a la Junta de Calidad Ambiental, al Departamento de Recursos Naturales y Ambientales, y a otras agencias gubernamentales para la ejecución de sus deberes y funciones; (b) efectuar todas aquellas pruebas y análisis necesarios para determinar el estado de los terrenos y la calidad del agua, el aire y de los componentes biológicos, químicos o físicos de cualquier recurso o sistema natural que se requieran como parte del proceso de concesión, modificación, suspensión, revocación o fiscalización de cualquier permiso, licencia u otro tipo de autorización de la Junta de Calidad Ambiental; (c) realizar pruebas y análisis necesarios para fiscalizar el cumplimiento de las leyes, reglamentos y órdenes que regulan la calidad de los recursos de agua, aire y terrestres de Puerto Rico; (d) hacer investigaciones científicas relacionadas con los recursos naturales y ambientales existentes en Puerto Rico y divulgar sus resultados.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Regional Act No. 23 on territorial protection, management and use
Policy_Content: It is hereby laid down the regional legislative framework in matter of territorial use, management and planning. The overall objective pursued is sustainable development in the management of the regional territory. The Act applies both to the Natural and Environmental System (SNA) of the Region and to urban settlements. The objectives of the regional territorial policy shall be defined in the Regional Structural Framework (QSR) as per article 12. Further programmes shall be adopted by the Provinces and the Communes as regards local level. Article 10 is devoted to the Regional Chart on Soil, which shall define the perimeter of the systems included in the regional territory as well as the initiatives and protective measures to be undertaken in accordance with Act No. 183 of 1989.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

The Regulation defines operation and working practices (Part 2), transport systems (Part 3), ventilation (Part 4), emergency procedures (Part 5), fire control (Part 6), controlled materials (Part 7), monitoring and detecting equipment (Part 8), electrical equipment (Part 9), explosives (Part 10) and airborne dust (Part 12).

Policy: Law No. 824-I on protection of the population and the territories against environmental and technological disasters.
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates social relations in the sphere of protection of the population and the territories against environmental and technological disasters and is directed at the prevention of the emergencies, reduction of damages caused thereby and liquidation thereof. The public shall have free access to the information regarding protection of the population and the territories (art. 5). The Ministry of Emergencies shall be the authorized institution entitled with the tasks of protection against the emergencies (art. 8). Monitoring and prognostication of emergencies shall be carried out by special supervision and control services over disasters, technological accidents and catastrophes (art. 14). Determination of the boundaries of the areas of emergencies shall be carried out by the directors of state bodies, enterprises, institutions and organizations in conformity with the classification of emergencies (art. 21). The Law consists of 27 Articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree-Law No. 335/99 establishing the legal regime for agricultural cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law establishes the legal regime for agricultural cooperatives. It consists of 4 Chapters divided as follows: Definition (Chap. 1); Multisector cooperative (Chap. 2); Other cooperatives (Chap. 3); Relationship of agricultural cooperatives with MADRP (Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries) (Chap. 4). It specifies that a cooperative is considered an agricultural cooperative when its aim is: agricultural, livestock or forestry production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decree No. 293 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on maximum residue limits of pesticides in foodstuffs of animal origin.

State Veterinary Service shall be authorized state institution competent to perform supervision of maximum residue limits in foodstuffs.

Policy: Karnataka Electricity Reform Act, 1999 (No. 25 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The Act establishes the constitution of an Electricity Regulatory Commission for the State of Karnataka to provide for the restructuring of the electricity industry in the State. It aims at performing the following activities: to corporate the Karnataka Electricity Board and rationalise the generation, transmission, distribution and supply of electricity in the State; to provide for avenues for participation of private sector entrepreneurs in the electricity industry in the State and generally for taking measures conducive to the development and management of the electricity industry in the State in an efficient, economic and competitive manner to provide reliable quality power and to protect the interest of the consumer including vesting in the Commission the powers to regulate the activities of the power sector in the State. The Act also contains provisions on the re-organisation of the Karnataka Electricity Board and the transfer of board's functions, properties, liabilities, etc. to the Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation to be set up by the State Government. Additionally, the Act lays down the process for obtaining the license for the transmission and supply of electricity in the State.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Loi nº 99-022 portant code minier.
Policy_Content: A l'intérieur du territoire national sont soumis aux dispositions du présent code et de ses textes d'application, la prospection, la recherche, l'exploitation, la possession, la détention, le transport, la transformation et la commercialisation des substances minérales à l'exception des ressources en eau et des hydrocarbures liquides ou gazeux qui sont régis par des dispositions spéciales. Le code est formé par 238 articles répartis en 13 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Régime des permis miniers (II); Régime de l'orpaillage (III); Régime des fossiles et substances dont les gîtes sont rares (IV); Obligations attachées à l'exercice des activités minières (V); Relations des titulaires avec les propriétaires des sols erelations entre les titulaires (VI); Détention, transport, transformation et commercialisation des produits des mines (VII); Garantie de stabilité des investissements miniers (VIII); Infractions et manquements aux obligations (IX); Comités nationaux et provinciaux des mines (X); Dispositions diverses (XI); Dispositions transitoires (XII) et Dispositions finales (XIII).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ordonnance n° 99-032/p-rm portant Code minier en République du Mali.
Policy_Content: Sont soumis aux dispositions du présent Code minier, la reconnaissance, l’exploration, la prospection, la recherche et l’exploitation de substances minérales, ainsi que leur possession, leur transport, leur traitement et leur commercialisation, à l’exception des hydrocarbures liquides et gazeux.Les substances minérales ou fossiles soumises au régime des mines dans le territoire de la République duMali appartiennent à l’Etat. Toutefois, les titulaires des titres miniers d’exploitation acquièrent la propriété des substances minérales ou fossiles qu’ils extraient. Les droits à ces substances constituent une propriété distincte de cellede la surface. Le régime des mines se différencie de celui des carrières. Les gîtes des substances minérales ou fossiles soumis au régime des mines sont classés en deux groupes: 1) pierres précieuses, pierres fines et fossiles et 2) toutes autres substances non soumises au régime des carrières et n’appartenant pas au groupe pierres précieuses, pierres fines et fossiles.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Regional Act No. 13 amending Regional Act No. 16 of 6 April 1996 rearranging the legislation relating to forestry and vegetation protection.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act lays down amendments and addenda to Regional Act No. 16 of 6 April 1996, which has re-arranged the legislative framework in matter of forest protection. Article 4 of the above-mentioned Regional Act is hereby replaced by article 1, which gives a new definition of forest. Forests are surfaces of not less than 10,000 square metres with forest plants, trees and shrubs covering at least the fifty percent of the total surface. If such surfaces are temporarily lack of vegetation due to natural causes, including fires, they shall be still qualified as forests. Article 10 is hereby replaced by article 3, which prohibits building on certain areas. Article 4 contains provisions for the minor islands which pertain to the Sicilian Region. Article 8 concerns reforestation interventions to be undertaken, giving regard to the propagating material which is admitted.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regulation on forest fire prevention.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, Natural Resources and Forestry, which is composed of 14 Paragraphs and two Annexes, establishes that fire prevention depends on the following risk levels: category I (high risk); category II (medium); and category III (low). Details on the assessment of the risk level are explained in the Annexes. Observation of the forest is required for all categories. Paragraph 11 specifies the types of fire-fighting equipment for the given categories. Paragraph 12 defines when admittance to the forest shall be forbidden.

Policy: Regional Act No. 23 regulating the gathering, cultivation, conservation and marketing of truffles.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Act, which consists of 24 articles, regulates the gathering, cultivation, conservation and placing on the market of truffles, in compliance with the principles established at the national level by Act No. 752 of 16 December 1985. The aims pursued are the promotion, development and improvement of the truffle sector as well as the conservation of the environmental balance of territories concerned. All truffle species are protected (art. 2, par. 1). Damaging and uprooting of underground parts of truffles are prohibited, without any prejudice to the controlled gathering regulated under article 3. Truffles may be freely collected in forests and cultivated lands. Entities in charge of the management of parks and nature reserves may lay down further provisions, in order to safeguard the ecosystem concerned. Article 5 defines controlled truffle areas as those delimited surfaces where truffles grow spontaneously and where improving operations are carried out. Article 6 lists out the different types of improving operations, such as pruning, drainage and government of surface waters, irrigation on quarries' surfaces. Article 7, on the other hand, refers to cultivated truffle areas. Article 8 regulates the procedure for the recognition of truffle areas. Consortia may be established for the protection, gathering, marketing and improvement of truffles (art. 9). Article 11 regards the authorization that is required for truffles gathering. Furthermore, article 11 specifies the equipment which may be used as well as the periods and hours during which gathering is permitted. The Region shall allocate financial resources with a view to encouraging research and experimentation, disseminating information concerning the truffle sector, arranging training activities for operators of the truffle sector. The Regional Forestry Body shall ensure the enforcement of this Act by carrying out inspections (art. 18). Penalties are laid down in article 19.

Policy_Content: Les dispositions de l'article 4 du décret n° 96/237 /PM du 10 avril 1996 fixant les modalités de fonctionnement des Fonds Spéciaux prévus par la loi n° 94/01 du 20 janvier 1994 portant régime des forêts, de la faune et de la pêche sont modifiées ainsi qu'il suit: "(1) Les ressources du Fonds Spécial sont constituées par: la quote-part du produit des taxes forestières, reversée au Fonds Spécial et dont le montant est déterminé, annuellement, par la loi de finances; les frais de participation du concessionnaire aux travaux d'aménagement; les recettes affectées par la loi; les subventions, contributions, dons ou legs de toute personne physique ou morale.(2) La quote-part du produit des taxes forestières visée à l'alinéa (1) ci-dessus est reversée par le ministre chargé des finances, en deux tranches semestrielles, au compte ouvert par l'Agent comptable du Fonds Spécial de Développement des Forêts, après adoption par le Comité de Programmes des projets annuels et des budgets correspondants, suivant l'échéancier ci-après: 1ère tranche, le 30 septembre au plus tard; 2e tranche, le 31 mars au plus tard".

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Forestry) (England and Wales) Regulations 1999 (S.I. No. 2228 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The Environmental Assessment (Forestry) Regulations 1998, S.I. provided for the implementation in relation to forestry projects in Great Britain of Council Directive 85/337/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment. The present Regulations have been made to implement, for England and Wales, changes made to that Directive by Council Directive 97/11/EC. They also implement for England and Wales the extension of both Directives to the Contracting Parties of the European Economic Area (EEA) under Article 74 and Annex XX paragraph I.1 of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, as given effect by Decision No. 20/1999 of the EEA Joint Committee adopted on 26th February 1999. As in the 1998 Regulations, there is a prohibition on carrying out any work or operations in relation to a project which is a "relevant project" unless consent has been obtained from the Forestry Commissioners or, on appeal, the "appropriate Authority". A new provision gives the Forestry Commissioners power, in accordance with Directive 85/337/EC, as amended, to exempt particular projects from the application of the Regulations (reg. 4). "Relevant project" is defined in regulation 3. A person who proposes to carry out a project may apply to the Commissioners for an opinion as to whether the project is a relevant project (regs. 5 to 8). Applications to the Commissioners for consent for a relevant project must be accompanied by an environmental statement which must contain the information required by Schedule 1 to the Regulations. The Commissioners may request further information from the applicant and other bodies holding relevant information are also required to make it available. There are requirements to publish the application and any further information and to invite representations. Where it appears that the project may be likely to have significant effects on the environment in another State in the European Economic Area, provision is made for the authorities of that State to be consulted before a decision is made. The Commissioners are given powers to serve enforcement notices where relevant projects are carried out without consent or in breach of conditions. The person served with such a notice may appeal to the appropriate Authority. Penalties are specified for breach of an enforcement notice.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Chemical Safety Information, Site Security and Fuels Regulatory Relief Act (P.L. 106–40).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Clean Air Act to provide for reporting and disseminating information under section 112(r) of that Act. It, among other things concerns public access to Off-Site Consequence Analysis (OCA) data and risk management of flammable liquids. Flammable fuels used as fuel or held for sale as fuel at a retail facility are removed from coverage by the Risk Management Program (RMP). However, flammable fuels used as a feedstock or held for sale as fuel at a wholesale facility are still covered. A retail facility is a facility “at which more than one-half of the income is obtained from direct sales to end users or at which more than one-half of the fuel sold, by volume, is sold through a cylinder exchange program.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 351 implementing Directive 96/62/EC on ambient air quality assessment and management.
Policy_Content: With a view to implementing Directive 96/62/EC in matter of ambient air quality management and assessment, the present Legislative Decree lays down principles to be applied in order to: (a) establish the objectives to be attained to prevent, avoid and reduce harmful effects to human beings and to the environment; (b) assess the ambient air quality; (c) obtain adequate information as regards ambient air quality and make it available to the public; (d) maintain ambient air quality where it is good and improve it in other cases. The Central Government, the Regions, the Provinces, the Communes and other local entities shall be responsible for the implementation of these provisions. Limit values are to be adopted by Decree of the Ministry of the Environment as prescribed by article 4. The Regions shall assess the ambient air quality by following the procedure described under article 6. Adequate information on ambient air quality as regards the pollutants referred to in article 4 shall be made available to the public. The Regions shall transmit to the Ministry of the Environment and to the Ministry of Health the information specified in article 12.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 372 implementing Directive 96/61/EC concerning integrated pollution prevention and control.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Legislative Decree is to achieve integrated prevention and control of pollution arising from the activities listed in Annex I, in order to reach a high level of protection of the environment taken as a whole. It lays down measures aimed at reducing and preventing emissions in the air, water and land from said activities ( which are, among others, energy industrial activities, production and processing of metals, waste management ). An authorization is compulsory to operate all or part of installations listed in Annex I. The competent authority shall issue such authorization only when the installation complies with the principles and requirements laid down in articles 3 and 6. Article 7 establishes the conditions under which the competent authority shall renew and update the authorization. The holders of the installations referred to in Annex I must submit every year to the Ministry of the Environment, through the National Agency for the Protection of the Environment ( ANPA ) a report providing all the information on their emissions in water, air and land. Article 13 lays down penalties. Four Annexes are attached.

Policy: Instruction on organization and carrying out educational activity in protected areas.
Policy_Content: Ecological education shall be one of the principal activities entrusted to the administration of protected areas.  Educational activity shall be conducted by means and methods complying with the status of protected areas. The purposes of educational activities shall be: (a) support of the activity of protected areas by vast strata of the population; (b) solution of regional ecological problems; and (c) formation of ecological conscience and ecological culture among the population. Ecological education shall be carried out by the officials of protected areas. Ecological tourism shall be promoted as a traditional form of ecological education.

Policy_Content: The principal Regulations provide for payment of aid to farmers who undertake for five years to permit members of the public to have access to an area of set-aside land. Policy: Decree No. 269 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on environmental standards for petrol filling stations, oil handling terminal and mobile oil tanks.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes rates of environmental standards and mandatory environmental protection requirements for petrol filling stations, oil handling terminal and mobile oil tanks, and also the duties and obligations for state bodies for enforcement of the aforesaid requirements. Policy: Order No.18 of 1999 of the State Committee on Construction and Housing and Communal Complex regarding validation of Instructions on the modalities of carrying out state control the use and protection of land in urban and countryside settlements.
Policy_Content: Deputy chief of the State Committee on Construction and Housing and Communal Complex orders to validate the Instructions. The present Instructions contains directions as regards the modalities of carrying out state control over the use and protection of land in urban and countryside settlements, including temporary settlements and inconstant structure of the population concerning issues assigned to the competence of the institutions of architecture, urban construction and the State architectural and construction survey. These Instructions are destined for the officials and commissions attached to the institutions of the State architectural and construction survey that carry out within their limits of competence control over the use of land in the settlements. The authorized institutions entitled to carry out control over the use of land in the settlements in accordance with the plenary powers established by urban construction and land legislation, include the State Construction Committee, architectural and urban construction bodies of the subjects of the Russian Federation, urban, district and municipal architectural and urban construction bodies and bodies of the State architectural and construction survey. The document consists of VIII Sections. Section I lays down the general provisions. Section II determines the main directions of activity of the architectural and urban construction bodies as regards control over the use of land in the settlements. Section III determines control over the observance of the requirements of urban construction and land legislation in the process of the use and protection of land in the settlements. Section IV regards legalization of the documents in cases of the infringement of urban construction and land legislation. Section V regards examination of cases of the infringement of urban construction and land legislation. Section VI regards examination of complaints and objections to the decisions concerning cases of the infringement of urban construction and land legislation. Section VII regards collection and expenditure of revenues from fines for the infringement of urban construction and land legislation. Section VIII establishes the modalities of forwarding reports regarding control over the use and protection of land in the settlements.

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Sededema”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Sededema” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Sededema” shall perform the following functions: (a) creation of conditions for protection, replacement and reproduction of biodiversity; (b) conservation of natural environment of indigenous peoples and their traditional forms of economic activities; (c) scientific research and environmental monitoring; and (d) propaganda of nature protection. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of resource reserve: (a) hunting, fishing in excess of the established quotas, destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (b) collection of various specimen; (c) introduction of plants and animals for acclimatization, measures to increase the number of certain wild fauna species above natural capacity of land; (d) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; (e) flight of aircraft lower than 500 m, overcoming the sound barrier by technical means, as well as other types of noise pollution impact exceeding established limits; (f); movement, passage and transit of extraneous persons;  (g) exploration, mining and all types of soil cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations and industrial timber extraction; (h) water resources management and any activity modifying hydrological regime of surface water and groundwater; and (i) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. By agreement with the regional Ministry of Environmental protection can be authorized the following activities: (a) scientific research; (b) performance of required fire-fighting, sanitary and epidemiological arrangements; (c) rehabilitation activity in areas damaged by natural disasters or by unauthorized human activities; (d) collection of specimen for scientific research purposes; and (e) presence of herdsmen in order to find and remove horses from the territory of the zone of absolute rest. This excludes movement on motorized vehicles and stay in the zone of absolute rest with firearms and any other hunting gear.

Policy: Regulation on protected area unique lake “Genkude”.
Policy_Content: Lake “Genkude” shall be classified as protected area. It shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of unique landscape; (b) reproduction and replacement, and also rational and regulated management of fishery resources and other biological resources; and (c) ecological monitoring and propaganda of nature protection. Water reserves of lake “Genkude” shall be conceded primarily for meeting the demand of the population for potable water and household needs. Water shall be supplied in accordance with special authorization (license). Use of aquatic and biological resources shall require payment of fee and shall be authorized within established limits (quotas). By agreement with the authorized regional state body in the sphere of environmental protection shall be authorized the following activities: (a) limited collection  of wild growing medicinal plants, berries and mushrooms; (b) grazing of horses, cattle and haymaking; (c) scientific and educational tourism; (d) hydro amelioration, irrigation, dredging aimed at improvement water and oxygen regime of the lake, performed in the presence of scientific substantiation; and (e) monitoring of water quality and biological diversity by specialized bodies. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) discharge of domestic and non-domestic waste; (b) navigation on motorboats and motor transport; (c) water logging; (d) water abstraction without fish protection devices; and (e) construction and placement of waterworks.

Policy: Regulation on protected area unique lake “Nijili”.
Policy_Content: Lake “Nijili” shall be classified as protected area. It shall perform the following functions: (a) reproduction and replacement of aquatic, fishery and biological resources; (b) rational and regulated management of fishery resources and other biological resources; and (c) ecological monitoring and propaganda of nature protection. Water abstraction shall be performed in accordance with special authorization (license). Commercial fishing of a crucian carp shall be authorized within the established limit. Local residents shall be authorized to perform fisheries of crucian carp with nets for personal consumption. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) scientific research with a view of study of fish stocks, fishfarming and ecological state of the lake; (b) scientific and educational tourism; (c) sanitary felling of forest species, except for main use felling; (d) hydro amelioration aimed at improvement water and oxygen regime of the lake, performed in the presence of scientific substantiation; (e) grazing of horses, cattle and haymaking; (f) collection of berries and mushrooms by local population. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting for all species of waterfowl and wild ungulates; (b) navigation on motorboats and motor transport; (c) water logging; and (d) construction and placement of waterworks.

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Kenkeme”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Kenkeme” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Kenkeme” shall perform the following functions: (a) creation of conditions for protection, replacement and reproduction of biodiversity; (b) scientific research and ecological monitoring; and (c) propaganda of nature protection through organization of environmental tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) water resources management and any activity modifying hydrological regime of surface water and groundwater; (b) construction and placement of industrial facilities, high-voltage lines and main pipelines; (c) exploration, mining, any types of soil cover and vegetable cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations, industrial timber extraction; (d) traffic and parking of motor vehicles outside public roads and waterways of common access, water logging, passage of livestock; (e) collection of various specimen, except for scientific research purposes; (f) hunting, fishing in excess of the established quotas, destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (g) introduction of plants and animals for acclimatization, measures to increase the number of certain wild fauna species above natural capacity of land; (h) application of pesticides,  as well as to combat pests, plant diseases and weeds and for the purpose of regulation of number of animals; (i) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; (j) flight of aircraft lower than 500 m, overcoming the sound barrier by technical means, as well as other types of noise pollution impact exceeding established limits; (k) movement, passage and transit of extraneous persons without prior authorization by the regional state body in the sphere of environmental protection; and (l) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. By agreement with the regional environmental protection bodies can be authorized the following activities: (a) (a) scientific research; (b) performance of required fire-fighting, sanitary and epidemiological arrangements; (c) rehabilitation activity in areas damaged by natural disasters or by unauthorized human activities; (d) fee-paid artisanal fishing and licensed commercial fisheries; (e) in some case regulated environmental tourism; and (f) traditional nature management (horse breeding, reindeer breeding, haymaking, collection of wild growing berries and mushrooms).

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Beloozersky”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Beloozersky” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Beloozersky” shall perform the following functions: (a) maintaining the natural state of protected natural complexes and preserving biological diversity; (b) restoration and development of traditional forms of management of the local population; (c) environmental monitoring; (d) scientific research; (e) creation of conditions for regulated tourism and organized recreation in natural conditions; and (f) organization of events on environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting for all species of wild ungulates; (b) destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (c) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; (d) application of pesticides and fertilizers; (e) movement and parking of vehicles without official need and outside public roads and common access waterways; (f) landing of aircraft without permit of environmental protection bodies and flying over reserve territory at an altitude of less than 500 meters; (g) unauthorized stay of extraneous persons not related to traditional nature management nor reserve employees; (h) industrial procurement and collection of berries, mushrooms and medicinal plants; (i) exploration, mining, any types of soil cover and vegetable cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations, industrial timber extraction; (j) construction and placement of industrial facilities, high-voltage lines, main pipelines and roads; (k) any activity modifying hydrological regime of surface water and groundwater; and (l) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) scientific research; (b) haymaking, grazing of cattle as form of traditional economic activities and traditional nature management; (c) collection of berries and mushrooms within established periods; (d) licensed fisheries, licensed commercial hunting for fur-bearing animals within established quotas within areas of licensed management of wild fauna species; (e) regulated environmental tourism; and (f) intermediate felling.

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Pilka”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Pilka” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Pilka” shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation, reproduction and restoration of the population of American mink, salmon species, grayling, waterfowl, wild ungulates and the range of Siberian cedar forests; (b) conservation of reference, unique and sacred for the indigenous population natural complexes and objects; (c) ecological education of the population; and (d) monitoring of natural complexes, communities and populations. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) fisheries, hunting for waterfowl, wild ungulates, American mink; (b) water management and any actions modifying hydrological regime of surface water and groundwater, navigation of motorboats; (c) main use felling; (d) construction and placement of industrial facilities, high-voltage lines, main pipelines and roads; (e) exploration, mining, any types of soil cover and vegetable cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations, industrial timber extraction; (f) traffic and parking of motor vehicles outside public roads and waterways of common access, water logging, passage of livestock; (g) collection of various specimen, except for scientific research purposes; (h) hunting in excess of the established quotas, destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (i) application of pesticides,  as well as to combat pests, plant diseases and weeds, and also for the regulation of number of animals; (j) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; (k) flight of aircraft lower than 500 m, overcoming the sound barrier by technical means, as well as other types of noise pollution impact exceeding established limits; (l) movement, passage and transit of extraneous persons without prior authorization by the authorized regional environmental protection body; and (m) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. By agreement with the regional environmental protection bodies can be authorized the following activities: (a) scientific research; (b) performance of required fire-fighting, sanitary and epidemiological arrangements; (c) rehabilitation activity in areas damaged by natural disasters or by unauthorized human activities; (d) collection of specimen for scientific research purposes; (e) licensed hunting (capture) of wild fauna species, except for ungulates, within established quotas; and (f) in some case regulated environmental tourism.

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Ochuma”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Ochuma” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Ochuma” shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of typical landscapes of the Western Yakutia, the system of big and small lakes, wild fauna and wild flora; (b) restoration of the number of fur-bearing animals, preservation of the habitats and mating grounds of waterfowl and upland game, wild ungulates; (c) preservation and protection of places of temporary accumulations and transit stops of migratory birds - singing, predatory, waders, ducks, geese, swans and cranes, as well as many nesting places, including rare birds like the black crane; (d) scientific research and environmental monitoring; and (e) preservation of spawning and feeding grounds for fish, including valuable species - whitefish, grayling, lenok, taimen, sturgeon on inflows of the rivers Holomolooh, Ogogut and Ygyatta. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of resource reserve: (a) (a) hunting for wild ungulates, upland fowl and waterfowl; (b) commercial fisheries and artisanal fishing; (c) destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (d) presence with hunting gear and dogs; (e) main use felling; (f) industrial collection and procurement of berries, mushrooms and medicinal plants; (g) industrial activity, construction of industrial infrastructure; (h) exploration, mining, any types of soil cover and vegetable cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations, industrial timber extraction; (i) burning of vegetation, application of pesticides; (j) unauthorized presence of extraneous persons; (k) flight of aircraft lower than 500 m; (l) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; and (m) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) traditional nature management (horse breeding, reindeer breeding, haymaking, collection of wild growing berries and mushrooms); (b) fee-paid artisanal fishing and hunting; and (c) in some case regulated environmental tourism.

Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Troitsky”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Troitsky” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Troitsky” shall perform the following functions: (a) creation of conditions for protection, replacement and reproduction of biodiversity and genetic resources thereof; (b) conservation of natural environment of indigenous peoples and their traditional forms of economic activities, culture and way of life; (c) conservation of reference, unique and sacred for the indigenous population natural complexes and objects; and (d) ecological monitoring. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of resource reserve: (a) hunting, fishing in excess of the established quotas, destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (b) collection of various specimen; (c) introduction of plants and animals for acclimatization, measures to increase the number of certain wild fauna species above natural capacity of land; (d) pollution of the territory by domestic and non-domestic waste; (e) flight of aircraft lower than 500 m, overcoming the sound barrier by technical means, as well as other types of noise pollution impact exceeding established limits; (f); movement, passage and transit of extraneous persons;  (g) exploration, mining and all types of soil cover disturbance, plowing up, blasting operations and industrial timber extraction; and (h) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. By agreement with the regional environmental protection bodies can be authorized the following activities: (a) scientific research; (b) performance of required fire-fighting, sanitary and epidemiological arrangements; (c) rehabilitation activity in areas damaged by natural disasters or by unauthorized human activities; (d) sanitary and selective felling for the needs of the reserve; (e) limited fishing, collection of wild growing berries and mushrooms for messing of the gamekeepers of the reserve; (f) limited commercial hunting of fur-bearing animals by contract hunter in winter period; and (g) fee-paid artisanal hunting.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
