Policy: Regulation on resource reserve “Tomporuk”.
Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Tomporuk” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Resource reserve “Tomporuk” shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; and (b) protection of habitats of wild animals, restoration and preservation of the number of waterfowl and wild ungulates. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of resource reserve: (a) hunting, fishing in excess of the established quotas, destruction and capture of wild animals and birds, destruction of burrows, nests and other hiding places and shelters, as well as all kinds of changing conditions of animal habitats; (b) artisanal fishing in the water basin of the river Tomporuk; (c) collection of berries, mushrooms and medicinal plants; (d) presence of motor vehicles without official need and ground movement of transport outside public roads; (e) landing of aircraft without permit of environmental protection bodies and flying over reserve territory at an altitude of less than 500 meters; (f) unauthorized stay of extraneous persons not related to traditional nature management and the functioning of the reserve; (g) unauthorized construction of tourist facilities; and (h) any activity damaging the state of natural complexes or contrasting the objectives of resource reserve. By agreement with the regional environmental protection bodies can be authorized the following activities: (a) scientific research; (b) limited fishing by local population and gamekeepers for messing; (c) collection of eggs with a view of subsequent breeding in other protected areas and re-acclimatization; (d) licensed hunting within established quotas; and (e) sanitary and selective felling for the needs of the population performing traditional nature management.

Policy_Content: Resource reserve “Byas-Kuel” shall be classified as national nature reserve – protected area. Policy: Regulation on protected area unique lake “White Lake”.
Policy_Content: Lake “White Lake” shall be classified as protected area. It shall perform the following functions: (a) reproduction and replacement of aquatic, fishery and biological resources; (b) rational and regulated management of fishery resources and other biological resources; and (c) ecological monitoring and propaganda of nature protection. Water reserves of lake “White Lake” shall be conceded primarily for meeting the demand of the population for potable water and household needs. Water abstraction shall be performed in accordance with special authorization (license). The following activities shall be authorized: (a) fee-paid fishing in the period from 1 November to 1 April within established limits; (b) grazing of horses, cattle and haymaking without use of technical means; (c) collection of berries and mushrooms by the local population in the established time periods; (d) scientific and educational tourism; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, dredging aimed at improvement water and oxygen regime of the lake, performed in the presence of scientific substantiation; and (f) commercial hunting of fur-bearing animals in the presence of hunting authorization (license). The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting for all species of waterfowl and wild ungulates; (b) navigation on motorboats and motor transport; (c) water logging; and (d) construction and placement of waterworks. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting for all species of waterfowl and wild ungulates; (b) navigation on motorboats and motor transport; and (c) construction and placement of waterworks.

Policy: Environmental Protection (Restriction on Use of Lead Shot) (England) Regulations 1999 (S.I. No. 2170 of 1999).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit the use of lead shot for shooting with a shotgun: (a) on or over any area below the high-water mark; (b) on or over the sites of special scientific interest included in Schedule 1 to the Regulations; or (c) any wild bird included in Schedule 2 to the Regulations namely ducks and geese (all species of each), coot and moorhen (regulation 3). "Lead shot" means any shot made of lead or of any alloy or compound of lead where lead comprises more than 1 percent of that alloy or compound (reg. 2). Regulation 4 provides for powers of entry and inspection, a power to take samples, and a power to take any dead or injured wild birds, in order to determine whether any provisions of the Regulations have been broken. Regulation 5 provides that breach of regulation 3, or obstruction of a person exercising any power under regulation 4, is a criminal offence.

Policy: Ley de derechos y culturas indígenas del Estado de Chiapas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto reconocer y proteger a los pueblos indígenas del Estado de Chiapas, como así también los derechos de las comunidades indígenas asentadas por cualquier circunstancia, dentro del territorio del Estado, pertenecientes a cualquier otro pueblo indígena. La Ley presta especial atención a los derechos de las mujeres indígenas: se reconoce su derecho a adquirir bienes por transmisión hereditaria o por cualquier otro medio legal, así como a tener cargos al interior de la comunidad y a participar en programas productivos para el desarrollo comunitario, en iguales condiciones que el varón (art. 33). El Capítulo VIII está dedicado a las tierras, quedando prohibidos los reacomodos y desplazamientos de los habitantes de las comunidades indígenas de sus propiedades o posesiones, salvo que se motiven por causa de utilidad pública plenamente justificada o por casos de riesgos, desastres, seguridad o sanidad. El Capítulo IX se refiere a la explotación de los recursos naturales por parte de las comunidades indígenas.

Policy: Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1727/1999 laying down certain detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 2158/92 on protection of the Community's forests against fire.
Policy_Content: Regulation 2158/92/EEC of 23 July 1992 set up at Community level a scheme for the protection of forests against fires. In accordance with article 4 of the said Regulation, Member States shall submit annually to the Commission their projects or programmes for improving protection of forests against fires. The present Regulation lays down implementing measures as regards the programmes aforementioned. In fact, they shall contain the information and supporting documents specified in Annex I (such as contact of the competent authority, fire-risk zones concerned, duration and total cost of the programme, etc.) and shall furthermore comprise the information indicated in article 2.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 447 validating the Regulation on the Narochanski National Park.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 4 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general requirements; 2) the structure of the territory and the applicable regime of management; 3) managing bodies; 4) the rights and the competence of the National Park; 5) protection of the National Park; 6) liability; 7) research and educational activity; 8) international cooperation; 9) the state and the public supervision; 10) termination of activity. The Narochanski National Park has been set up for the purpose of conservation of the unique natural ecosystems and efficient use of recreational facilities.  The main tasks of the National Park shall be: 1) conservation of the group of lakes and of the genetic fund of vegetable and animal realms; 2) environmental education of the population; 3) scientific research; 4) conservation of cultural heritage; 5) recreation. Land of the National Park shall be considered of environmental importance and any activity contrary to the purposeful use thereof shall be prohibited. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the National Park: 1) acclimatization of alien wildlife and plant species; 2) work that may cause alteration of water reservoirs, water bodies and groundwater or have negative impact upon the National Park; 3) discharge of untreated sewage and waste into water reservoirs and water bodies; 3) timber rafting; 4) hauling timber with the use of track-type vehicles; 5) prospecting and construction of drainage systems  within the range of five kilometres from the boundaries of the National Park; 8) other activities that may have negative impact.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal fixant les prescriptions générales pour les dépôts de gasoil d’une capacité allant de 300 litres à 20.000 litres en matière d’établissements classés.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement a pour objet de fixer les conditions de mise en place et d'exploitation des dépôts de gasoil dont la capacité totale s'étend de 300 litres à 20000 litres, y compris ces deux valeurs. Le texte comprend 15 articles comme suit: Objet (art. 1er); Définition (art. 2); Normes applicables (art. 3); Réservoirs (art. 4); Installation des réservoirs aériens (art. 5); Installation des réservoirs souterrains (art. 6); Installation et équipement des tuyauteries (art. 7); Réservoirs mis hors service (art. 8); Contrôles de réception (art. 9); Vérifications et contrôles périodiques (art. 10); Autorités compétentes (art. 11); Sanctions pénales (art. 12); Entrée en vigueur (art. 13); Dispositions transitoires (art. 14); Exécution (art. 15). Une annexe est jointe.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement grand-ducal entre en vigueur le 1er août 1999.

Policy: Regional Act No. 19 on Agricultural Development Services in the Calabria Region.
Policy_Content: In conformity with the framework laid down by Regulation 270/79/EEC, this Regional Act makes rules on the Agricultural Development Services of the Calabria Region, whose fundamental aims are the development of agriculture, the promotion of the socioeconomic development of rural areas and the increase of the productivity of farms. The Agricultural Development Services consist of the following: (a) Research of regional interest and experimentation; (b) Dissemination of information on agriculture; (c) Training; and (d) Technical support services.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Order No. 210 of the Ministry of Natural resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the method of calculation of emission of pollutants to the atmosphere in the course of uncontrolled burning of oil and oil products.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of calculation of emission of pollutants to the atmosphere in the average flare in the course of uncontrolled burning of oil and oil products and in case of oil spill. This calculation method shall be used for the calculation of environmental damage and the sum of compensation therefore. The Order shall be compulsory for all legal and natural persons operating on the national territory. This calculation method shall be applicable to hydrocarbons without hazardousness class.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: The Order enters into force on 1 September 1999.

Policy: Law No. 91 on protection and management of historical and cultural heritage.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal framework in the sphere of protection and management of the objects of historical and cultural heritage. The objectives of this Law shall be: (a) consolidation of legal status of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; (b) regulation of rights and duties of state bodies, enterprises, institutions, organizations, associations and citizens in relation to conservation of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; (c) delimitation of competence of state bodies in the sphere of protection of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; and (d) liability for damages caused to the objects of historical and cultural heritage. Objects of historical and cultural heritage shall be subject to state protection. Immovable objects of historical and cultural heritage shall include channels, drainage systems and urban forests (gardens, parks). The purpose of protection of the aforesaid objects shall be registration, conservation and maintenance thereof.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Brandenburg Land Use Planning Law.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the planning of land and soil belonging to the Land Brandenburg. Such land shall be preferably regulated by leases and building rights. In particular, special consideration shall be given to principles and aims of land use planning. Furthermore, the Ordinance shall promote local and regional development, conserve forest areas, waters areas, protect nature, improve agricultural infrastructures, secure agricultural development, and forestry infrastructures. The use of land of special value for the conservation and development of nature and landscape is authorized, provided that its utilization takes into due account the need for a sustainable development. The text consists of 7 articles.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal fixant les prescriptions générales pour les établissements du secteur agricole qui relèvent de la classe 4 en matière d'établissement classés.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement a pour objet d'arrêter les conditions d'aménagement et d'exploitation auxquelles sont soumis les établissements nouveaux du secteur agricole, relevant de la classe 4 conformément au règlement grand-ducal du 16 juillet 1999 portant nomenclature et classification des établissements classés. Les établissements concernés par le présent règlement qui sont nouvellement mis en place et exploités doivent être déclarés à l'Administration de l'Environnement avant leur première exploitation. L'article 3 discipline la protection de l'environnement. Cet article traite, parmi d'autres, les silos à fourrages verts qui seront établis de manière à empêcher l'incommodation du voisinage par les mauvaises odeurs ainsi que la pollution de l'environnement. Le texte est formé par 8 articles et 1 annexe.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 2732 establishing Inter-professional organizations under the responsibility of the Ministry of Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles, establishes Inter-professional organizations under the responsibility of the Ministry of Agriculture. These organizations are non-profit private bodies constituted in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Code by the representatives of all or part of the various economic activities and professional organizations, associations or bodies which represent those engaged in activities relating to the production and/or processing and/or marketing and, where appropriate, the standardization or distribution of agricultural and general agricultural goods, agri-food, forestry, fisheries and other production sectors under the responsibility of the Ministry of Agriculture. The Law amends Law 1565/1985 relating to the application of the provisions included in the Schedule, and stating that fertilizers are considered organoleptic and inorganic for the use of which increases production and improves the quality of the products. In addition, it amends certain terms, categories and their meaning.

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Altai Territory regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Altai Territory have agreed as follows: 1). The Parties will interact in all the main issues regarding the development of agro industrial complex of the Altai Territory. 2). The Government of the Russian Federation: shall elaborate and finance federal programs of development and consolidation of material and technical basis of agro industrial complex and support of producers of agricultural commodities of all types of property; shall finance on account of federal basis subsidies and incentives for support of agro industrial complex, extension of grazing, carrying out zoo veterinary and anti epizootic arrangements, development of elite seed-growing and pedigree livestock breeding, plant protection, agrochemical arrangements in accordance with federal special programs validated by the Government of the Russian Federation; shall determine and carry out the main directions of federal policy in the field of social development of the rural area; shall take steps for the improvement of State Standards, branch standards, technical requirements and other technical and normative documentation in the sphere of agro industrial production. 3). The administration of the Altai Territory: shall provide for stable development of agro industrial complex and increase of the manufacturing of agricultural commodities under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions on the basis of improvement of production and economic relations and productive forces, development of various forms of property and economic activity; shall ensure purposeful and efficient utilization of funds allotted from federal budget and timely repayment of financial resources allotted on repayable basis, shall finance territorial special programs of the agricultural development; shall provide for rational use of the stock of land, improvement of soil fertility and land reclamation; shall form regional food reserves and regional reserve stock of seeds; shall provide for delivery of agricultural commodities of the coordinated amount to federal stock of foodstuffs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agreement No.3 of 1999 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Altai Territory regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of ownership, use and management of subsoil.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Altai Territory have agreed as follows: 1). This Agreement establishes the main provisions as regards the delimitation of the competence and plenary powers between federal and territorial executive bodies in the sphere of ownership, use and management of subsoil. 2). The administration of the Altai Territory is authorized in accordance with the federal legislation to elaborate and enact within its competence normative and legal acts on the use of subsoil that must not contradict federal laws and other normative legal acts. 3). State management of the relationship in the sphere of the use of subsoil is carried out on the part of the Russian Federation by the Government of Russian Federation and by the Ministry of Natural Resources within its sphere of competence, on the part of the Altai Territory – the administration of the Altai Territory. 4). The modalities of the use of subsoil for mine workings of generally used minerals on the territory of the Altai Territory are established by state executive bodies of the Altai Territory on the basis of general regulations on the use of subsoil and its protection established by the legislation of the Russian Federation. 5). Licensing of activity connected to the use of the parcels of subsoil of regional and local importance is carried out by the administration of the Altai Territory in accordance with the modalities established by laws and other normative legal acts of the Russian Federation and the Altai Territory. 6). Administration of the parcels of subsoil on the territory of the Altai Territory, not classified as federal ones is carried out on the basis of the legislation of the Russian Federation and of the Altai Territory on subsoil. 7). The administration of the Altai Territory determines in accordance with the established modalities specific rates of payment for the use of subsoil on the basis of federal norms (top limits). State bodies of the Altai Territory fix rates and forms of payment of charges for the use of subsoil of the regional and local importance. 8). The administration of the Altai Territory and the Ministry of Natural Resources of the Russian Federation are authorized to decide jointly the issues regarding the utilization of geological information obtained by financing out of federal budget.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agreement No.7 of 1999 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Altai Territory regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Altai Territory have agreed as follows: 1). The Russian Federation and the Altai Territory, within the plenary powers assigned to them by the legislation of the Russian Federation, carry out state regulation in the field of environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena, including assessment of the atmospheric conditions, surface water of the dry land and groundwater and the determination of the sources of financing of activity regarding environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena. 2). Financing of activity regarding environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena must be carried out on account of: a). federal budget, as regards carrying out of work and data collection for federal needs; b). regional budget as regards carrying out of work and data collection for regional needs; c). revenues for trade of specialised informational products (work, service) in accordance with contracts with juridical and physical persons. 3). The Government of the Russian Federation provides for carrying out common state policy in the field of environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena, elaboration and realization of federal special programs regarding environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena. 4). The Administration of the Altai Territory provides for realization of state policy in the field of environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena on the territory of the Altai Territory, elaboration and realization of regional special programs regarding environmental monitoring and prognostication of dangerous natural phenomena.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Compensation for Damage Caused by Hazardous Substances (No. 2350-RS of 1999)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for compensation for damage caused by hazardous substances. Its purpose is to ensure compensation for damage to human life and health, environment, sites of historic and cultural significance, and to property and economic interests as a result of environmental impacts caused by hazardous substances, irrespective of the fault of a responsible person. The requirements of this Law shall not apply to hazardous substances intended for personal use that are utilised in accordance with the procedure prescribed by the legislation of Georgia. The compensation for damage to human health and environment as a result of pollution by hazardous substances shall be carried out in accordance with the procedure provided for by the legislation of Georgia. Legal matters related to the compensation for damage caused by pollution of soil and water resulting from the use of minerals in high mountainous regions, shall be established by the Law of Georgia on Soil Protection and the legislation of Georgia.

Policy: Law No. 2347-RS on licence fees.
Policy_Content: Pursuant to Article 94 of the Constitution of Georgia and the Law of Georgia on the Principles of the System of Fees, this Law define the types and rates of fees established by the State for licences, and establishes terms and procedures for their payment. A license fee (save the local license fees fixed by agencies of local self-government and administration) shall be a single mandatory sum payable to the central budget by natural and legal persons for the right to engage in the activities defined by law, as well as for certain services rendered by the State. Licences shall be granted to legal or natural persons for the right to engage in the activities defined by the Law of Georgia on Licensing of Entrepreneurial Activity and by other statutes, including: (a) manufacture of veterinary drugs; (b) exploration and extraction of mineral resources; (c) production, repair and trade of firearms; (d) land use planning; and (e) hydrotechnical and land improvement engineering.

Policy: Instructions No. 2 implementing Law No. 8302 of 12 March 1998 'On the administration of incomes generated by the State Forests and Pastures'.
Policy_Content: All communes that have received in use state forests and pastures should deposit, into a special bank account opened for the communal forests and pastures project, all revenues paid by the villagers and/or other users. These incomes may be in the form of tariffs for collecting working materials, firewood, oak leaf and fodder; penalties, sales of seized forest materials; and any other type of tariffs and levies related to the use of the forests and pastures. At the beginning of each year, the communes, in cooperation with the head of each village and the village commission on forests and pastures, should evaluate the requests for utilization of the forests and pastures and prepare the annual contracts. The inspector of the forest services (DGFP Field District Office) shall approve the contracts before they enter into force. A certain quota of revenues constitutes the Investment Fund to be used for the improvement of the communal forests and pastures. The Investment Fund is managed through a Management Board. The committee of the Association for the Use of the Communal Forests and Pastures prepares, in cooperation with the communal forest specialist and based on priorities expressed by the village committees, the plans for the use of the Investment Funds in those areas such as forest treatment, improvements and protection of degraded areas.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Procedure for Expropriation of Property for Pressing Social Needs (No. 2349-RS of 1999)
Policy_Content: The goal of this Law is to define the procedures for granting the right of expropriation and for carrying out expropriation for pressing social needs. Expropriation for pressing social needs shall be carried out on the basis of an order of the Minister of Economy and Sustainable Development of Georgia, and a court decision that has been taken in favour of the state body, or local self-government body, and/or legal entity under public or private law, who may be granted the right of expropriation in accordance with this Law. Expropriation for pressing social needs shall be carried out for the implementation of construction of roads and highways; laying of railway lines; laying of pipelines for crude oil, natural gas, and oil products; construction of power transmission and distribution lines; laying of water supply, sewerage, and rainwater collector pipelines; laying of telephone lines; laying of TV cables; construction of structures and facilities for pressing social needs; works for national defence; or operations for the extraction of natural resources.

Policy: Ministerial Joint Decree No. 19652/1906 on waters affected by nitrate pollution deriving from agricultural sources – Catalogue of vulnerable zones and amendment of Ministerial Decree No. 16190-1335 of 1997.
Policy_Content: Aim of this Decree is the implementation of paragraphs 1 and 2 of article 4 to Ministerial Decree No. 16190/1335/1997, in compliance with the provisions of paragraphs 1 and 2 respectively of article 3 to  Council Directive 91/676/EEC. It also aims at amending the above-mentioned Decree in such a way that the protection of waters can be effectively achieved: a) by identifying those water basins that are susceptible to nitrate pollution of agricultural origin and classify them as “vulnerable”, and b) by simplifying the procedures pursuant to article 5 of Decree No. 16190/1335/1997. According to the above and the conditions set forth in article 4, paragraph 3a of Decree No. 16190/1335/1997, this Decree establishes the Catalogue of vulnerable zones and identifies among them the following four areas: 1) Western and Eastern Thessaly; 2) Kopaida; 3) Argolikos; 4) Pineios river basin. The delimitation of these areas are pinpointed on maps attached to this Decree. The Catalogue shall be revised or supplemented as needed. In the vulnerable areas, action programmes shall be established and implemented in order to reduce water pollution from nitrogen compounds. In the above-mentioned areas, follow-up and monitoring programmes shall be applied and shall be repeated per four-year period while at the same time shall be assessed the eutrophication of waters. This Decree also amends articles 3, 4, 5, and 8 of Decree No. 16190/1335/1997.

Policy: Ley Nº 37 - Ley de gestión ambiental. Texto refundido.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece los principios y directrices de política ambiental; determina las obligaciones, responsabilidades, niveles de participación de los sectores público y privado en la gestión ambiental y señala los límites permisibles, controles y sanciones en esta materia. Dispone que la gestión ambiental se sujeta a los principios de solidaridad, corresponsabilidad, cooperación, coordinación, reciclaje y reutilización de desechos, utilización de tecnologías alternativas ambientalmente sustentables y respecto a las culturas y prácticas tradicionales. El proceso de Gestión Ambiental, se orientará según los principios universales del Desarrollo Sustentable, contenidos en la Declaración de Río de Janeiro de 1992, sobre Medio Ambiente y Desarrollo.

Policy: Arrêté royal instaurant une avance pour les entreprises qui sont touchées directement par la crise de la dioxine de 1999.
Policy_Content: Considérant que des mesures doivent être prises sans délai afin de sauvegarder la position financière des entreprises touchées par la crise de la dioxine, notamment de celles qui risquent de se trouver, suite à cet événement extraordinaire, en situation de cessation de paiement, il a été établi que les entreprises qui démontrent que les produits d'origine animale, destinés à la consommation qui soit contaminés, soit dont la date de péremption est dépassé suite aux mesures de saisi conservatoire dans le cadre de la crise de la dioxine prises par les autorités belges, européennes ou les autorités de pays tiers peuvent, à leur demande, obtenir, pour une période de cinq ans, une avance sans intérêts et récupérable à charge de l'allocation de base "avances récupérables aux entreprises touchées par la crise de la dioxine". En outre, l'article 3 établit qu'auprès du Ministère des Classes moyennes et de l'Agriculture, une Commission spéciale est créée, composée d'une ou de plusieurs chambres néerlandophones et francophones, en vue de délivrer les attestations visées à l'article 4 aux entreprises touchées par la crise de la dioxine. Policy: Decree No. 1105 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve shall be allotted the area of 90447 hectares and shall have as its purpose the conservation of the unique floodplain ecosystem of the Pripyat river with the population of rare and endangered plants and game recorded in the Red Book of Belarus. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve: 1) any activity causing change of the natural landscape and hydrological regime, and soil disturbance; 2) slash-disposal fire and burning out dry vegetation; 3) discharge of sewage and waste disposal in water bodies; 4) clearing of riverside natural growth except for recreational areas; 5) setting up tourist camps; 6) main felling and gradual felling in pineries, oak forests, ash forests and hornbeam forests; 7) main felling in the black alder forests, birch forests and aspen forests with cutting area more than one hundred metres wide with the period of the progressive coupes on contiguous strips less than four years. The proclamation of Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve shall not entail the expropriation of land. The regional executive bodies shall be the managing authority of Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve. Land tenants must observe the regime of protected area and use ecofriendly processes. The damages caused to Srednyaya Pripyat biosphere reserve shall be compensated by the legal and natural persons in conformity with the modalities established by law.

Policy: Law No. 438-I on electric energy.
Policy_Content: This Law governs the issues of electric and thermal energy production, distribution and use. The Law consists of five Chapters divided into 21 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) state management and regulation of the energy sector; (3) centralized efficient-dispatch management; (4) energy supply; (5) electric energy management in emergency situations. The state management of the energy sector shall provide for: (a) regulation of electric and thermal energy market; (b) rational use of electric and thermal energy and energy saving; (c) use of renewable energy sources; (d) environmental protection in the process of electric energy equipment operation. The state management of the energy sector shall consist of: (a) licensing; (b) state supervision over the application of safety requirements during energy generation, distribution and consumption; (c) general regulation of energy generation, distribution and consumption. Licensing in the energy sector shall be carried out in accordance with the national legislative provisions.

Policy: Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999.
Policy_Content: The objects of this Act are: (a) to provide for the protection of the environment, especially those aspects of the environment that are matters of national environmental significance; (b) to promote ecologically sustainable development through the conservation and ecologically sustainable use of natural resources; (c) to promote the conservation of biodiversity; (d) to promote a cooperative approach to the protection and management of the environment involving governments, the community, land-holders and indigenous peoples; (e) to assist in the cooperative implementation of Australia's international environmental responsibilities; (f) to recognize the role of indigenous people in the conservation and ecologically sustainable use of Australia's biodiversity; and (g) to promote the use of indigenous peoples' knowledge of biodiversity with the involvement of, and in cooperation with, the owners of the knowledge. The Act implements obligations of Australia deriving from international agreements including the Convention on Biological Diversity of 1992.

Policy: Ley Nº 27/1999 - Ley de cooperativas. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de cooperativas (Texto consolidado) define la cooperativa como una sociedad constituida por personas que se asocian, en régimen de libre adhesión y baja voluntaria, para la realización de actividades empresariales, encaminadas a satisfacer sus necesidades y aspiraciones económicas y sociales, con estructura y funcionamiento democrático, conforme a los principios formulados por la alianza cooperativa internacional, en los términos resultantes de la presente Ley. Cualquier actividad económica lícita podrá ser organizada y desarrollada mediante una sociedad constituida al amparo de la presente Ley. La denominación de la sociedad incluirá necesariamente las palabras «Sociedad Cooperativa» o su abreviatura «S. Coop.». Las sociedades cooperativas podrán revestir la forma de cooperativa de primero y segundo grado, de acuerdo con las especificidades previstas en esta Ley.

Policy: Measures for review and accreditation of mineral resources reserves.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to safeguard the right and interest of state ownership of mineral resources, plan, manage, rationally use, and protect mineral resources, promote the development of the mining industry, and strengthen the management of mineral resources reserves. The Measures, consisting of 28 articles, provide for the procedures, requirements for the review and accreditation of mineral resources reserves. Article 5 lists the reserves of mineral resources which must be subject to review and accreditation.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Regional Law No. 22-OZ “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning forest ecosystems, rational management, protection, conservation and reproduction of forests with a view of raising ecological and resource potential thereof. Objects of forest relations shall be forest fund (public forest), right of use of forest parcels pertaining to forest fund, management of forests not included in forest fund, and tree and shrubbery vegetation. All the forests, except for forests of defence and urban forests, and also unforested forest land shall form forest fund. Forest parcels of forest fund can be allotted on lease for the period from 1 to 5 years without tender to forest managers carrying long-term forest management on the aforesaid forest parcels and in possession of timber extraction and timber processing facilities. Forest management shall be authorized exclusively in accordance with felling licence, permit or forest management authorization that can be issued in the presence of contract of lease, concession of free-of-charge forest management.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1545/1999 amending Regulation (EC) No. 1091/94 laying down certain detailed rules for the implementation of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 3528/86 on the protection of forests against atmospheric pollution.
Policy_Content: On the permanent observation plots to be set up in compliance with Regulation 1091/94/EC intensive and continuous surveillance of the forest ecosystems shall be carried out. The inventories to be carried out shall also include, on the basis of the new version of article 1 of Regulation 1091/94/EC (laid down in article 1, paragraph 1 of this Regulation) soil solution sampling and analysis as well as ground vegetation assessment. Annex V to this Regulation is added to Regulation 1091/94/EEC as Annex XI. It contains the common methods for ground vegetation assessment in permanent observation plots.

Policy: Regional Law No.33 of 1999 regarding liability for trade of motor oil not complying with ecological requirements.
Policy_Content: This Law, for the purpose of further reduction of hazardous impact of motor transport on environment and public health of the inhabitants of the city of Moscow, establishes liability of legal persons for trade of motor oil not complying with ecological requirements. The document consists of 8 Articles. Article 1 establishes liability for trade of motor oil not complying with ecological requirements. Article 2 regards suspension and cancellation of licence. Article 3 concerns institutions entitled to carry out control over compliance with ecological requirements of motor oil in circulation. Article 4 establishes the modalities of determination of offences and application of fines. Article 5 determines the modalities of utilization of revenues from fines. Article 6 regards hindering officials of the controlling institutions. Article 7 establishes the modalities of appeal against the actions undertaken by officials of the controlling institutions. Article 8 determines the modalities of entry into force of the present Law.

Policy: Native Title (Prescribed Bodies Corporate) Regulations 1999.
Policy_Content: For these Regulations, a number of common law holders constitute a group of common law holders if they belong to a tribe, clan or family, or a descent, language or other group, recognized as such in accordance with Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander traditional laws and customs applying to them. An Aboriginal association is prescribed for section 59 of the Native Title Act 1993 if it is incorporated under the Aboriginal Councils and Associations Act 1976 for the purpose of being the subject of a section 56 or 57 determination. An Aboriginal association is taken to be incorporated for the purpose of being the subject of a section 56 or 57 determination only if criteria set out in regulation 5 are met. A prescribed body corporate may be a trustee for, or act as an agent or representative of, more than 1 group of common law holders in relation to a native title determination if the determination applies to each group. Functions of prescribed body corporate acting as trustee are set out in regulation 6.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy_Content: This Act is divided into 5 Parts. Part 3 outlines the Business of the Corporation giving it authority to make loans, guarantees and securities. Policy: Acuerdo Gubernativo Nº 522-99 - Reglamento de la Ley de comercialización de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo Gubernativo consta de 73 artículos y tiene por objeto desarrollar las disposiciones contenidas en la Ley de Comercialización de Hidrocarburos para su correcta aplicación. Se establece que la Dirección General de Hidrocarburos será el órgano competente para la correcta y pronta aplicación de las disposiciones de la Ley y el presente Reglamento. Las solicitudes de licencia para actividades de refinación, transformación y de la cadena de comercialización de petróleo y productos petroleros serán también de conocimiento de este órgano. El reglamento fija normas detalladas sobre la importación y exportación de petróleo, su refinación y transformación, almacenamiento, transporte, estaciones de servicio, medidas de seguridad ambiental e industrial, procedimientos administrativos, etc.

Policy: Council Recommendation 1999/519/EC on the limitation of exposure of the general public to electromagnetic fields (0 Hz to 300 GHz).
Policy_Content: The Council hereby lays down particular recommendations as regards the limitation of exposure of the general public to electromagnetic fields. For the present purposes, the term electromagnetic fields (EMF) includes static fields, extremely low frequency (ELF) fields and radiofrequency (RF) fields, including microwaves, encompassing the frequency range of 0 Hz to 300 GHz. Member States, in order to provide for a high level of health protection against exposure to electromagnetic fields, should (a) adopt a framework of basic restrictions and reference levels using Annex I.B as the basis; (b) implement measures according to this framework, in respect of sources or practices giving rise to electromagnetic exposure of the general public when the time of exposure is significant with the exception of exposure for medical purposes where the risks and benefits of exposure, above the basic restrictions, must be properly weighed; (c) aim to achieve respect of the basic restrictions given in Annex II for public exposure.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Ley Nº 12.307 - Crea la Comisión Bicameral para la atención y seguimiento de desastres naturales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la creación, en el ámbito de la Legislatura de la Provincia de Buenos Aires, de la Comisión Bicameral para la atención y seguimiento de desastres naturales provocados por emergencias hídricas o de carácter climático. Sus funciones esenciales serán las siguientes: a) proponer un sistema normativo que atienda las consecuencias de posibles situaciones de emergencias provocadas por desastres naturales o hídricos en el ámbito de la Provincia; b) atender a las necesidades regionales de la Provincia en relación con la instrumentación por Ley de regímenes económicos especiales que compensen los perjuicios sufridos por los productores afectados por las mencionadas emergencias.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1066 validating the Regulation on State Cartographic and Geodetic Fund.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that State Cartographic and Geodetic Fund shall contain geodetic, cartographic, topographic, hydrographical, aerospace and gravimetric materials and data obtained in the course of geodetic and cartographic activity of public and intersectoral importance. State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography shall be in charge of permanent storage of the aforesaid materials and data. Legal and natural persons carrying out geodetic and cartographic activity shall submit a copy of geographic and cartographic materials elaborated thereby to the Fund free of charge. Materials and data contained in the Fund shall be national property. Transfer of materials and data form the Fund to third party and copying thereof shall be carried out by authorization of the State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography. Materials and data from the Fund shall not be subject to trade and can only be transferred for temporary use for copying.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1067 validating the Regulation on state supervision over geodetic and cartographic activities.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree defines the role of state supervision over geodetic and cartographic activities as: (a) monitoring compliance with normative and technical requirements; (b) ensuring the correct mapping of state boundaries; (c) registering such activities; and (d) managing the transfer and storage of, and access to, geodetic and cartographic information. The Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography shall be the state institution responsible for supervising geodetic and cartographic activities. State geodetic supervisory bodies shall oversee the printing and publication of maps, geographic plans and atlases and shall issue authorizations for carrying out geodetic and cartographic activities.

Policy: Federal Soil Conservation Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the conservation of soil and rehabilitation of contaminated sites. In particular, the Ordinance is applicable to the analysis of suspect land, harmful change of soil, requirements concerning decontamination and safety measures as well as other protection and restriction measures, requirements concerning preventive measures on soil protection, and the fixing of threshold values. The text consists of 14 Articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Requirements concerning the analysis of suspect land and contaminated sites (II); Requirements concerning the rehabilitation of harmful change in the soil and contaminated sites (III); Completing provisions for contaminated sites (IV); Exceptions (V); Completing provisions for the prevention of harmful soil changes as a consequence of soil erosion caused by water (VI); Prevention of harmful change in the soil (VII); Final provisions (VIII). Four Annexes are enclosed as follow: Requirements for sampling, analysis and quality assurance during the investigation (1); Action, test and precautionary measures (2); Requirements for remediation investigation and plan (3); Requirements for the investigation and assessment of areas suspect to harmful soil change due to the soil erosion by water.

Policy: Regional Law No. 41-oz “On soil fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds of the relations between landowners, landlords, land tenants (including foreign natural and legal persons land lease holders) and state bodies in the sphere of ensuring soil fertility of agricultural land, and also establishes rights and duties of natural and legal persons performing agricultural production in relation to efficient use of soil fertility. Soil fertility of all types of agricultural land must ensure sufficient conditions for crop growing without oppression of soil organisms. Soil layer of agricultural land must be free of hazardous and toxic substances for human health and agricultural animals exceeding maximum established residue limits after application of fertilizers, nutrients and pesticides.Fertility of agricultural land shall be intended the ability of soil to meet the needs of agricultural crops for nutrients, air, water, heat, biological and physical-chemical environment and to ensure the yield of agricultural crops. Restoration of fertility of agricultural land shall be intended directed changes in factors of soil fertility, which provide expanded reproduction of soil fertility and compensate for the loss of production potential of soil. State management and supervision in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land shall be performed on all land of agricultural purpose regardless of organizational and legal form, ownership form, actual condition and use thereof.

Policy: Regional Law No. 162-ZPO "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the process of functioning of state bodies, local government, enterprises, institutions and organizations irrespectively of organizational and legal form thereof and the population, in the sphere of protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters. It shall have the following purposes: (a) determination of the jurisdictional competence of state bodies, local government and organizations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters with the consideration of geographic and climatic particulars of the regions; (b) prevention of the outbreak and propagation of disasters; (c) reduction of damages and losses caused by disasters; and (d) rehabilitation of the territory. Regional territorial subsystem of the national early warning system shall be responsible for data collection, processing and dissemination of the information related to disasters and timely information of the population thereof.

Policy: Sub-Decree on Environmental Impact Assessment Process.
Policy_Content: This Decree aims to define an environmental impact assessment on all projects being evaluated by the Ministry of Environment. It aims to define the nature and size of the proposed activities and encourage public participation in environmental impact assessment (art. 1). The Ministry of Environment is charged with evaluating the environmental assessment report and monitoring compliance with the report during the construction and closure of projects (art. 3). The prospective project owner must apply for the environmental assessment report and feasibility report to the Ministry of Environment. The report will examine the environmental impact on natural resources, ecosystem, human health and public welfare (art. 8). Project owners or proprietors that fail to implement the environmental management plan are liable to penalties (art. 29).

Policy: Loi nº 99-574 d'orientation agricole.
Policy_Content: Cette loi définit la nouvelle politique agricole de la France et modifie de façon conséquente divers articles du Code rural. La politique agricole prend en compte les fonctions économique, environnementale et sociale de l'agriculture et participe à l'aménagement du territoire, en vue d'un développement durable. Ses objectifs sont harmonisés avec la politique agricole commune et la préférence communautaire. La politique agricole prend en compte les situations spécifiques à chaque région, notamment aux zones de montagne, aux zones humides précisément délimitées dont les particularités nécessitent la mise en place d'une politique agricole spécifique, aux zones défavorisées et aux départements d'outre-mer, pour déterminer l'importance des moyens à mettre en oeuvre pour parvenir à ces objectifs. La politique forestière participe de la politique agricole dont elle fait partie intégrante. Elle est mise en oeuvre en concertation avec les organisations professionnelles représentatives et avec les collectivités territoriales en tant que de besoin. La loi comprend 143 articles répartis en 8 titres, à savoir: Les contrats territoriaux d'exploitation (I); Exploitation et personnes (II); Fonctionnement des organismes de mutualité sociale agricole (III); Organisation économique (IV); Qualité, identification et sécurité des produits (V); Gestion de l'espace agricole et forestier (VI); Formation des personnes, développement agricole et recherche agronomique et vétérinaire (VII); Dispositions diverses (VIII).

Policy: Law No. 488-XIV on expropriation for public needs.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the issues of expropriation regarded as transfer of property and the right of ownership from private ownership to public ownership, or concession of ownership rights to municipal unit or to the state for the purpose of execution of public works after equitable compensation. Objects of expropriation shall be: (a) immovable property such as plots of land, subsoil, waterbodies and forests; (b) right of ownership to flora and fauna. The Act consists of seven Sections divided into 22 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) public utility; (3) arrangements preceding expropriation; (4) judicial proceedings of the expropriation; (5) rights of persons subject to expropriation; (6) particulars of expropriation; and (7) conclusive provisions. Public utility for which expropriation is required shall be: (a) geological exploration and prospecting of subsoil; (b) mining; (c) energy production; (d) sewerage, water and gas supply; (e) constructions for environmental protection; (f) waterworks for water level regulation in rivers and water reservoirs, and also for reduction of flooding; (g) works for the prevention of soil erosion; and (h) plots of land for public housing construction, organization of public parks, storage and burial of waste. Public utility at the national level shall be stated by the Parliament and at the local level by local self-government.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Scotland) Regulations 1999 (S.S.I. No. 1 of 1999).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement, in relation to town and country planning, roads and drainage works in Scotland, Council Directive 85/337/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment. They revoke and re-enact, with amendments, the relevant Parts of the Environmental Assessment (Scotland) Regulations 1988. The main changes made by Directive 97/11/EC, which these Regulations implement, are as follows. The number of categories of project subject to environmental impact assessment (EIA) is increased. An individual determination on whether EIA is required must be made in respect of every project in Annex II to the Directive (Schedule 2 to these Regulations) which exceeds thresholds established by a Member State. Advice on the content of an environmental statement must be given to a developer who requests it before submitting an application. Competent authorities must give reasons for their decision on granting or refusing development consent. The Directive establishes detailed procedures for consulting other Member States on projects which are likely to have significant environmental effects in their territories. Policy: Forest Code.
Policy_Content: Forest legislation in accordance with the Constitution of the Kyrgyz republic shall consist of this Code, laws and other normative legal acts of the Kyrgyz Republic, which regulate forest relations in the Kyrgyz Republic. Forest legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic shall aim at guarding, protection, and regeneration of forests and hunting fund, ensure rational and sustainable forest use, proceeding from the state objectives for efficient management of forests and hunting fund, conservation of biological diversity of forest ecosystems, increase of ecological and economic forest potential, satisfaction of public needs for forest and hunting resources based on scientifically grounded and multipurpose management of forests and hunting fund. Forest legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic shall regulate the relations with respect to protection, guarding, reproduction, rational and sustainable use of forests, both within and outside the State Forest Fund, as well as use of unforested islands of the Forest Fund. Land and water relations, as well as those relating to the use of underground resources and other relations which emerge due to the use of the Forest Fund shall be regulated by the corresponding land, water, and other legislative acts of the Kyrgyz Republic. All the forests and land pertaining to public, municipal and private property destined for forestry shall form forest stock of the Kyrgyz Republic (art. 6). The Law consists of 11 Sections divided into 25 Chapters that contain 109 articles. Section 1 (chapts. 1-3) lays down the general provisions. Section 2 (chapts. 4-6) regards state management and control relating to guarding, protection, regeneration and use of forest fund. Section 3 (chapts. 7-8) determines rights and obligations of forest fund plot owners and forest users. Section 4 (chapts. 9-15) deals with forest uses. Section 5 (chapter 16) concerns forest fund guarding and protection. Section 6 (chapts. 17-18) establishes forest fund monitoring, registering, forest cadastre, forest inventory, forest planning. Section 7 (chapter 19) regards reproduction of forests. Section 8 (chapter 20) concerns settlement of forest disputes and responsibility for violation of forest legislation. Section 9 (chapts. 21-22) determines financing of forestry, reimbursement of losses. Section 10 (chapter 23) regards social protection and guarantees of state forest management body employees and their family members. Section 11 (chapts. 24-25) lays down the final provisions.
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regulation No. 65 of the Minister of the Environment approving the Guidelines for Selection of Key Biotopes and the Classifier of Key Biotopes.
Policy_Content: Key biotopes (valuable habitats) are areas requiring protection in a commercial forest, where the probability of occurrence of endangered, vulnerable or rare species is great. Selection of key biotopes consists in identification of such areas in commercial forests that correspond to the distinctive features specified in the Classifier of Key Biotopes and require protection. Selection of key biotopes shall be arranged by the Forestry Board through its local offices. Key biotopes can be selected by persons who have passed a training course on selection of key biotopes organised by the Forestry Board and have acquired the relevant certificate. Key biotopes shall be selected in the course of a regular total area survey of forest, or as a separate activity. Selected key biotopes shall be entered into the database of the Forestry Board. This Regulation gives description and classification of key biotopes in private (commercial) forests.

Policy: Law No. 10/99 on Forest and Wildlife Act.
Policy_Content: The Forest and Wildlife Act is divided into 9 Chapters: General (Chap. I); Protection of forest and wildlife resources (II); Sustainable forest resources exploitation regimes and Sustainable wildlife conservation regimes (III); Forest and wildlife resources restocking (IV); Management of forest and wildlife resources (V); Forest guarding (VI); Offences and penalties (VII); Final dispositions (VIII). The present Law establishes the basic principles and norms for the protection, conservation and sustainable utilization of forest and wildlife resources under an integrated management framework for the economic and social development of the country. The Law classificates the national forest heritage according to potential, location and mode of utilization different types and other conservation areas. The State promotes the reforestation for commercial, industrial or energy purposes and for recuperation of degraded areas, preferably on dunes, in watersheds and in fragile ecosystems. The wildlife heritage consists of all wild animals in the national territory and is classified in function of its rarity, economic and socio-cultural value for species listed under a special decree. The holder of a title, whether by virtue of occupation or through authorized request, to the right to use and make improvements on land does not necessarily have a licence to exploit the forest and wildlife resources in the respective area, save in those cases where such exploitation is undertaken solely for subsistence purposes. It defines different types of protected areas. Any illegal activity (such as fires in forest, crop field, woodland) shall be condemned up to one year of imprisonment and the corresponding fine, specified in the text.

Policy: LAW ON INVESTMENT (No. VIII-1312).
Policy_Content: The Law sets forth the terms and conditions of investment in the Republic of Lithuania, the rights of the investors and investment protection measures for all types of investments. The specific features of investment into commercial banks, other credit institutions, insurance companies and other undertakings engaged in financial activities shall be established by the laws of the Republic of Lithuania which regulate the activities of the above undertakings and institutions. “Investment” means funds and tangible, intangible and financial assets assessed in the manner prescribed by laws and other legal acts, invested in order to obtain from the object of investment profit (income), social result (in education, culture, science, health and social security as well as other similar spheres) or to ensure the implementation of state functions. “Investment” means the act of investing performed by the investor in the manner prescribed by this Law whereby he acquires the right of ownership or the creditor’s right of claim over the object of investment, or the right to manage and use the object. “Economic entities” means undertakings, agencies and organisations of all types and forms of ownership established in accordance with the procedure laid down in the laws of the Republic of Lithuania. Types of investment according to the investor’s influence on the economic entity: 1) direct investment - investment aimed at establishing an economic entity and acquiring the capital of a registered economic entity or a share in the capital, also reinvestment, loans to economic entities the capital whereof is owned by the investor or in which he has a share in the capital, subordinated loans where the objective of an investment is to establish or maintain long-term direct links between the investor and the economic entity in which the investment is made, and the share in the capital acquired through investment accords the investor a possibility either to control the economic entity or to exert a considerable influence upon it; 2) indirect (portfolio) investment - where a share in the capital acquired through investment does not accord the investor any possibility to exert any considerable influence on the economic entity. Types of investment according to the status of the investor: 1) state investment - investment made by using the national budget resources, state (municipal) fund resources, loans obtained in the name of the State of Lithuania (municipalities), resources of state-owned (municipal) enterprises and other stateowned (municipal) assets as well as loan guarantees extended by the state (municipalities), in order to meet the needs of the state; 2) private investment - investment by the holders of the right of private property of the Republic of Lithuania and foreign states; 3) investment by foreign states and international organizations. Domestic and foreign investors shall be guaranteed under this and other laws equal conditions for operation. The rights and lawful interests of investors shall be protected under the laws of the Republic of Lithuania. Investors shall have the right to acquire title to all types of immovable property in the Republic of Lithuania.

Policy: Regional Act No. 16 laying down the legislative framework on mountains
Policy_Content: In compliance with the general principles and rules set out in Act No. 97 of 1994, the Piemonte Region promotes the development of mountain areas and encourages the safeguarding of the regional mountain environment. The provisions laid down in this Act shall apply to (i) mountain territories corresponding to Mountain Communities and delimited as per article 3, and (ii) other territories classified as mountain territories. Mountain Communities are designated to be local entities in charge of the promotion and redevelopment of mountain areas, particularly through multiannual development plans and special intervention programmes. Mountain Communities shall also contribute to environmental and soil protection (art. 9). As regards management of forest resources, Mountain Communities may enter into special agreements with private and public proprietors and may also set up forestry consortia (art. 38). Article 50 provides for the establishment of the Regional Mountain Fund, whose resources shall be allocated in compliance with article 51. Moreover, the Regional Observatory on Mountains is set up by article 55 for the purposes of performing special studies and elaborating the annual report required by article 24 of Act No. 97 of 1994. The Regional Information System on Mountains (SIREM) shall be created as prescribed by article 56 with a view to supporting the activities and initiatives of the Observatory.

Policy: Law on seeds and crops insurance.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to regulate the relations arising between insurance company and citizens, business entities and organizations connected with the insurance of seeds and crops in the territory of Mongolia. Crops shall be intended cereals used for seed production purpose. Cereals shall be intended sown either on irrigated or non-irrigated soil wheat, barley, rye, millet, and corn and leguminous plants. Irrespectively of the form of ownership of agricultural business entity, the total area of 20% of irrigated cereals and 10% of non-irrigated cereals in the western region shall be subject to mandatory insurance against the following risks: (a) drought, flood, strong wind, storm, hail, frost, snow and extreme cold; (b) infectious plant diseases; (c) small insects and rodents; and (d) fires. Insurance of seeds and crops shall be regulated by contracts. This Law consists of III Chapters divided into 10 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards insurance of seed and crops insurance. Chapter contains miscellaneous provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Atomic Affidability Control Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements article 12b of the Atomic Energy Act of 23 December 1959, as amended and promulgated on 15 July 1985 dealing with verification of reliability of persons as a protection against a diversion or major release of radioactive material. As a protection against unauthorized acts which may lead to a diversion or major release of radioactive material, the responsible licensing and supervisory authorities are required to verify the requisite reliability of persons engaged in the handling or carriage of radioactive material and in the erection and operation of installations. Either a comprehensive reliability check (category 1), an extended reliability check (category 2) or a simple reliability check (category 3) shall be carried out. The text consists of 11 articles as follows: Sphere of application, definition of terms (1); Categories of reliability tests (2); Reliability tests to carry out (3); Obligation to carry out a reliability test (4); Rules for the different kinds of reliability tests (5); Proceedings (6); Termination of the reliability test (7); Duration of validity and repetition of reliability tests (8) Reliability tests in special cases (9); Transitional provisions (10); Entry into force, repeal (11).

Policy: Decree No. 791 relative to planning of the use of fertilising substances.
Policy_Content: According to provisions of this Decree users of arable land shall be responsible to prepare a plan for the use of fertilizing substances for the upcoming planting season in each year or a plan for a longer term in the case of use of animal manure or extensive cultivation. The scope of this planning is to secure an effective and rational use of fertilizing substances also for reasons of environment protection. The municipalities or the authorized agricultural authority shall control each plan in order to check if the plan has been drawn up in accordance with provisions of the present Decree. (7 sections)

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.187 - Crea el Fondo de Estabilización para el fomento de la exportación de carne leche y sus derivados.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea y organiza el Fondo de Estabilización para el fomento de la exportación de carne leche y sus derivados, que funcionará como una cuenta especial, administrada por la entidad que para el efecto contrate el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural. Los mecanismos para la estabilización de precios que utilizará el Fondo de Estabilización serán: 1) Compensaciones a favor de los productores, vendedores o exportadores, que ocurre cuando el precio internacional de la carne, la leche o de sus derivados, para el día en que se registre la operación en el Fondo, sea inferior al precio de referencia o al límite inferior de una franja de precios de referencia; en este evento, el Fondo de Estabilización pagará a los productores, vendedores o exportadores de tales productos una compensación de estabilización equivalente a un porcentaje de la diferencia entre ambos precios, fijado en cada caso por el Comité Directivo del Fondo. 2) Cesiones a cargo de los productores, vendedores o exportadores, que ocurre cuando el precio del mercado internacional de la carne, la leche y sus derivados, para el día en que se registre la operación en el Fondo, sea superior al precio de referencia o al límite superior de una franja de precios de referencia; en este evento, el productor, vendedor o exportador de tales productos, pagará al Fondo una cesión de estabilización, equivalente a un porcentaje de la diferencia entre ambos precios, fijado en cada caso por el Comité Directivo del Fondo.

Policy: National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan.
Policy_Content: This National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan, consisting of six Chapters, had its formal beginning in September 1996. Biodiversity includes all genes, species and ecosystems and the ecological processes of which they are a part. The overall objective of this Strategy and Action Plan is to provide an overview of the role that biodiversity plays in the social and economic well-being of the Nation, and to recommend the steps that need to be taken to ensure that biodiversity is conserved as economic development continues. The Vision expresses the connection between human and environmental well-being. The foremost goal is to ensure environmental sustainability, while promoting human well-being and addressing socio-economic needs. The Mission directs efforts toward integrated, bioregional planning and management for the Nation and suggests mechanisms for capitalizing on institutional assets now in place as well as improving capacities across the board.

INGEOMINAS tiene como objeto realizar la investigación y generar la información básica para el conocimiento geocientífico y aprovechamiento del subsuelo del territorio colombiano, lo cual involucra la investigación y el conocimiento de la evolución, la composición y la dinámica de la corteza terrestre, el inventario de zonas del subsuelo más favorables para la acumulación de hidrocarburos, minerales, carbones, fuentes de agua subterráneas y recursos geotérmicos, la investigación de procesos de aprovechamiento de estos recursos y de utilización de los materiales nucleares, así como la identificación y monitoreo de zonas sujetas a amenazas naturales y la evaluación de las restricciones de uso del territorio asociados a las condiciones geológicas.

Policy: Woodlot Licence Regulation (B.C. Reg. 190/99).
Policy_Content: This Regulation concentrates on woodlot licences and is divided into 6 parts as follows: 1 Minor change of boundary or area; 2 Major change of boundary or area; 3 Criteria that must be considered by the district manager in respect of a timber processing facility; 4 Timber processing facility production capacity; 5 Requirements that must be met before a timber processing facility may be authorized and 6 Types of conditions in respect of a timber processing facility. Section 47 of the Forest Act states that the district manager or regional manager, may change the boundary or area of the woodlot licence if permitted by the regulations and in accordance with the regulations, and with the consent of the holder of a woodlot licence. Accordingly part 1 and 2 of this Regulation set's out the specific requirements that must be complied with in doing so. Section 46 of the Forest Act deals with timber processing facilities. This Regulation specifies in detail the relevant amount of production capacity and other requirements that must be met in respect of timber processing facilities.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Decreto Nº 235 - Establece sistema de incentivos para la recuperación de suelos degradados.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto el sistema de incentivos a aplicarse, por un lapso de 10 años, al fin de estimular la ejecución de prácticas destinadas a la recuperación de suelos degradados. Se entenderá por suelos degradados aquellos que, por la carencia de fósforo, exceso de acidez, niveles de erosión, deterioro de la cubierta vegetal o por presentar otras limitaciones físicas, químicas o estructurales para su ocupación, no pueden ser utilizados eficientemente de modo sustentable en la producción agropecuaria. El Instituto de Desarrollo Agropecuario será el responsable de otorgar los incentivos previstos a quienes tengan la calidad de pequeños productores agrícolas.

Policy: Law No. 2197-Iic of 1999 on standardization.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal basis for standardization in Georgia and regulates relations in the sphere of standardization. The purposes of standardization are: (1) ensuring safety of products, processes and services for environmental protection, human life, health and property; (2) accumulation of natural, material and economic resources; and (3) protection of consumers’ rights in the sphere of ensuring of quality of the products. The document consists of X Chapters that contain 24 Articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-9) lays down general provisions. Chapter II (arts. 10-12) regards normative documentation in the field of standardization. Chapter III (art. 13) regards technical requirements. Chapter IV (art. 14) regards compliance requirements. Chapter V (arts. 15 and 16) regards information on normative documentation in the field of standardization, technical requirements and the procedure of ascertainment of compliance. Chapter VI (arts. 17-19) regards state control and survey over the observance of mandatory standards. Chapter VII (art.20) establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on standardization. Chapter VIII (arts. 21 and 22) regards financing of state standardization, state control and survey, and incentives for the application of standards. Chapter IX (art. 23) lays down transitional provisions. Chapter X (art. 24) lays down final provisions.

Policy: Law No. 2209 on the protection of cultural heritage.
Policy_Content: This Law is aimed at protecting Georgia’s cultural heritage and regulating legal relations in that regard. It covers all immovable monuments, separable parts of immovable monuments, objects with monument signs and immovable monument protection zones on the entire territory of Georgia, regardless of the form of ownership. Natural landscape protection zones and constructed environment regulation zones shall be classified as objects of cultural heritage. Natural landscape protection zones shall mean the territory protecting the natural and artificial landscape that provides optimal exposition to a monument. Constructed environment regulation zones shall mean territory that must meet the requirements of the historically formed spatio-compositional and structural planning system, architectural appearance, nature or scale of the finding, restoration and preservation. The territory must also meet the requirements on strengthening the significance of immovable monuments within urban development regulation zones and adapting new structures to the historical environment. Cultural heritage protection shall be exercised by government bodies, local and self-government bodies and legal and natural persons within the framework of the authority defined by the Law.
